text: Super: THE KHYBER PASS, AFGHANISTAN We're looking down at what used to be called "The End of World." A landscape that is both beautiful, and forbiddin In the center of this vista, there is a deep ravine. Pushing in on the ravine, there appears to be a giant ici over a cliff: AN ICE FALL. A 600 foot waterfall whose face is frozen so Pushing in still closer, there is a tiny black dot inchin the ice. A human figure. This is: JAMES BOND, BRITISH SECRET SERVICE AGENT, 007. Bond is sweating and straining, four hundred feet in the an ice-pick tethered to each hand, ice-cleats on his boot backpack. As he climbs, spider-like, pulling himself up, JAM A CLEAT into the ice, but - CRACK! A 50 foot stiletto of ice breaks off, CRASHING ont below. Regaining his foothold, Bond looks down: Certain d looks up: So very, very, far to go. Bond shakes his head:
There has to be an easier way to earn a living. Still, Bond climbs. Huffing, sweating, he goes up, and up
He's 25 feet from the top. He drives a first ice pick in. toehold. But when he slams the second pick in -

head_text.subj: THE ICE WALL SHATTERS, FALLING AWAY IN FRONT OF HIM. IN T
BOND LOSES HIS GRIP ON THE FIRST ICE PICK -

text: And 007 is now dangling, 575 feet in the air, staring at water - hanging only by the leather thread around his wri to the first ice-pick, still embedded in the wall. Bond pauses. Thinks. And coolly begins to swing himself b forth, in widening arcs, like a clock's pendulum. At the high point of his swing, Bond reaches back to smas pick into the ice - BUT MISSES. He looks up at:

head_text.subj: THE FIRST ICE PICK, STILL EMBEDDED IN THE WALL -

text: Beginning to work its way out. The tether, fraying.
Cautiously, 007 begins to swing a second time. Once. Twic the third arc, he swings the ice-pick viciously - but MIS

head_text.subj: THE FIRST ICE PICK, STILL EMBEDDED IN THE WALL -

text: Now jutting downward, barely holding. The tether is almos frayed through.

One last chance. Bond swings. Once. Twice. He reaches bac himself at the wall, lunging - AND SMASHES THE SECOND PIC ICE... Just as the tether finally snaps on the first one. he's all but home: He reaches over, grabs the first pick holding in the ice,) jabs it in, and continues upward.

location: THE TOP OF THE WATER FALL -

text: Exhausted, Bond reaches up, over the edge. He drives a pi through the ice, into the hard, flat, ground beneath the As he pulls himself up, (his full weight on the first ice smashes a second pick through the ice, into the waterbed,

head_text.subj: THE ENTIRE ICE FALL GIVES WAY -

text: Breaking off with a groan, tumbling onto the rocks below.
A torrent of water crashes over 007. Fighting the oncomin he crawls - on his belly - through the water - 25 feet in
Bond stands, walks out of the riverbed. He looks back at
On either side of the water, there are two small RADAR DI down, scanning every inch of the area, save for the water In other words: This was the only way in.

007 shrugs. From his backpack, he takes out TWO CIGAR-SIZ CANISTERS, and an ELONGATED BLACK BOX. He presses a butto side of the box, and - fwap, fwap, fwap - SNOW SKIS unfol He presses buttons on the canisters: TELESCOPIC SKI POLES slaps on the skis, and takes off, through the snow.
Bond hurtles over the side, going airborne, landing 100 f amidst boulders. In perfect Olympic form, he skis out, an

Bond slaloms down, in and out of trees, to avoid detectio bottom, where the snow thins, he comes to: A ROCK OUTCROPPING. Hiding behind the rock, Bond takes off his skis, knapsack unpacks (and unfolds) a HIGH TECH AUTOMATIC RIFLE. Puts o HEADSET. He creeps up on the rock, and looks out on:

head_text.subj: A SECRET MILITARY BASE/AIR STRIP, (BOND'S POV)

text: 50 feet down, 200 yards away: 50 MEN are unloading CARGO MILITARY TRANSPORT TRUCKS; there are TWO NORTH KOREAN MiG ground (one partially obscured by a truck,) plus FLATBEDS HELICOPTERS and SCUD MISSILES. Near a QUONSET HUT, a TRUCK-MOUNTED RADAR DISH scans the INFRARED GATLING GUNS mounted on either side.
Props his rife on the boulder, and peers through the GUN
He sees a closer (but still wide) telescopic view of men over weapons, and forklifts loading/unloading crates of m

head_text.subj: THE SAME SCENE ON A VIDEO WALL

text: (over a speaker)
Seven, in position.

Roger, Seven. Watching this display is M, TANNER, and a handful of MILI including a RUSSIAN GENERAL, BUKHARIN, and BRITISH ADMIRA an aging sea-lion with no love for M, or MI-6. M deals with the humorless Admiral by, well, humoring him
... What were you saying, Admiral? Something about this 'not being a job for a wine-sniffing, skirt-chasing playboy spy?'
- I'll be sure to acknowledge 007's 'assistance' in my report to the Prime Minister. But this is, still, a naval operation.
What do they say in Russia, General Bukharin? (asks questions in flawless Russian)
The general chuckles. Translates:
'In a joint operation, someone's nose always gets put out of joint.' M turns to Admiral Roebuck:
I'm interested in success, Admiral. Not who gets credit. (turning to:)
Mr. Tanner: What have we got? Tanner points to the video wall with a RED LASER PEN.
(ironically)
A regular terrorist swap meet. Death at discount: Two Chinese Long March Scuds, a pair of Soviet A-17 attack helicopters -
(interrupting)
Stolen -
And the crates look like American M-16 assault rifles, Chilean antipersonnel mines, six French Exocet missiles, and 75 - no maybe a hundred - kilograms of Czech made C-4 Semtech explosive. (beat)
Something for everyone. Fun for the whole family.
(freezing him with a glance)
What about ID's?
(pushes a button on a console)
One to seven: Deal the face cards.
Bond adjusts a knob on the scope.
On the video-screen, the picture zooms to a CLOSE UP of o arms traders. Tanner presses a button, and - almost insta man's bio and vitals appear on another video screen.
Gustav Meinholtz. Neo-Nazi, former East German STASI agent. Ties to the Beider-Meinhoff gang. (pressing a button)
Aces high, seven. Bid to the east. Bond shifts his aim, east. (Intercut as necessary) He zer another face, and the man's stats appear in London.
Vilko Barkoviac. Bosnian war criminal; thought to be operating freelance out of Teheran. (pressing a button)
Full house, seven. Bid to the North. Bond complies. Another face, another set of stats:
Sitoshi Isagura. Japanese religious fanatic. Wanted for the Tokyo subway -
(impatiently, cutting him off:)
I've seen enough. Let's finish this. (ordering M:)
Tell your man to drop back. We're initiating plan B -
But -
- Thank you, M. But this is more than your man can handle. (to Bukharin)
Are we in agreement?
(hesitant, at first)
- Yes. Yes.
Admiral - Moving swiftly, the Admiral has picked up a RED PHONE:
Command to Nelson: Authorization to fire.

location: STEAMING IN THE GULF OF OMAN -

text: Weapons authorized. Prepare to fire. On my count: Five. Four. Three. Two -
A launcher rotates, and - BOOM - a Cruise missile blasts
Cruise missile away -
FIRING OFFICER'S VOICE (Cont'd)
Time to target: Four minutes.
I appreciate your assistance, M. But this is now a military operation.
(urgently, to Tanner)
Bring up the tracking satellite. And get 007 out of there. Tanner hits a button - and a third video screen appears, satellite view of the area, detailing the Cruise's path a
One to seven: Exit target area. Repeat -
Seven to one. Negative. Wait.

Bond has taken his eye from the scope. He's peering at: THE MIG-29'S - ("MiG-1," AND "MiG-2") - A FORKLIFT appears from behind the TRUCK blocking the vie A TALL BALD MAN is riding the empty fork, with his back t
Puts his eye back on the scope, shifts the rifle -
Bond's scope view settles on THE BALD MAN. The forklift r back of the truck. HE STEPS OFF as the fork begins rising something. And as the man turns, FACING US to scan the ar
Oh, no.
Who is it?
(calling up his stats)
Kim Dae Yung. North Korean Nuclear specialist.
Meaning there may be nuclear material down there? Tanner nods. A look passes from M, to Bukharin, to Roebuc
Hugging the surface, crossing from water to land.
Time to target: Three minutes. (sfx: Beep!)
Target acquired. Weapon armed. Tension. Adrenaline. QUIET PANIC. On the SCREEN, the FORK pulled a RED BOX from the truck, a SHORT ROUND MAN appear
Who is that?!? What's in the box??
(punching buttons)
I don't know. He's not in the database -
(to Bukharin)
What's in the box, General? (he shrugs)
What's in the box???
(sheepishly) ... We usually... Transport... Weapons grade uranium. Shock sweeps the room. M turns on Tanner:
Will it go off?
Maybe. Maybe not.
Abort the cruise.
It's too late -
One to seven - one to seven -

Negative, one. NOT YET. THE TRUCK/MiG-l, ON THE GROUND/THROUGH THE SCOPE - THE BALD MAN slaps the back of the truck obscuring MiG-1. PULLS AWAY, revealing MiG-l's WING. Hanging from the weap NUCLEAR BOMB.
Mutters a curse.
Soviet SB-9 nuclear torpedo. Yield, one kiloton.
Will the cruise set it off?
Yes.
(to Bukharin)
Jesus. Can't you people keep anything locked up?
We didn't know it was missing.
Get me the Prime Minister. Alert NATO, the CIA, the Pentagon. (presses a button:)
Seven: This is a direct order. I want you out of there. Do you copy?

Bond's headset lies on top of the rock, along with the te sight - still broadcasting. Find Bond, crouching BEHIND the rock. Automatic rifle in GRENADE in the other. He pulls the pin, hurls it 40 feet Pauses. Waits, counting down time. Then - BOND SPRINGS. SHOOTS at one of the CRATES. IT BLOWS UP, j THE GRENADE EXPLODES. There's PANIC ON THE GROUND. Men running everywhere as TH GATLING GUN spins, and SENDS A HAIL OF FIRE at Bond's div And with this, BOND is off, SPRINTING INTO THE CHAOS. THE SAME SCENE - VIDEO SCREEN - MI-6 SITUATION ROOM. Stoned silence. Disbelief. Tanner whispers:
God help him.
God help the rest of us.

As various factions shoot at each other (Who's the traito streaks toward the action. Without breaking stride, he sw gun to the right: TWO BURSTS. THREE MEN DIE. Still runnin swings to the left: ANOTHER BURST. TWO MORE DOWN. Ahead, Bond sees the FLIGHT CREWS DASHING for the MiG's. beeline for MiG-1.
Slamming the gate on the RED BOX in a cargo truck. Rushin passenger door. Climbing in. The SHORT ROUND MAN floors t accelerator, driving them away.

Time to target: Thirty seconds. WIDE ON MiG-1 - The pilot climbs the ladder to the cockpit. Running at fu BOND LEAPS, pulls the man down. They fall to the tarmac, Bond SHOVES A KNIFE in the man's ribs, killing him. Kneeling, Bond takes the pilot's helmet off. He looks up: coming at him with a GUN. In one unbroken move, Bond YANK from the pilot's body and THROWS IT - thwack - into the m ANGLE ON MIG-2'S PILOT - WATCHING THIS FROM HIS COCKPIT.

Where the COPILOT (having climbed in from the other side, not the right guy. As he fumbles for a weapon, BOND BASHE THE HELMET. The copilot collapses into his seat, unconsci Bond settles into his seat, fires the engines, closes the canopy, and begins taxiing out.
The CRUISE SKIMS IN DIRECTLY OVER BOND'S PLANE, speeding (INT. BOND'S MiG) BOND SHOVES THE THROTTLES TO THE FIREBA
KA-BOOM!!!! The scene on the screen erupts in a GIANT EXP then turns to video-snow. Is Bond alive? No one in London

The FIREBALL grows and grows, a raging hell. And just whe no one could possibly survive: BOND'S MiG ROCKETS OUT OF INT. BOND'S MiG - Bond thinks he's safe. Sound. Until - MiG-2 FLIES OUT OF THE FIREBALL - Cannons blazing at 007. A hail of metal and tracers.
Bond goes into evasive maneuvers - jinks right, jinks lef suddenly, THE COPILOT REVIVES, and starts trying to STRAN with a METAL LANYARD. Struggling, Bond HEARS a THIN HIGH-
The pilot has locked onto Bond's MiG. Boom! TWO HEAT-SEEK MISSILES roar away.
Fighting the garrote, Bond KICKS THE THROTTLES forward an ON THE YOKE. The MiG goes into a spine crushing climb as THE TWO HEAT SEEKING MISSILES FOLLOW HIM, LOOPING UPWARD.
Bond's MiG has disappeared from the pilot's view: Not in on the left. Not on the right. Where did he go? The pilot

head_text.subj: BOND'S MIG APPEARS, FLYING INVERTED, COCKPIT DOWN, 10 FEE
THE PILOT OF MIG-2 IS STUNNED.

text: Fighting against the garrote, Bond strains to reach a RED the panel: COPILOT EJECTOR SEAT. Bond finally taps it, and - THE BACK HALF OF THE CANOPY B The COPILOT BLASTS OUT OF THE PLANE, DOWNWARD, directly i cockpit. Bond peels off. For a second, MiG-2 hangs in the air. Until... BOOM!!! Th SEEKING MISSILES BLAST IT TO SMITHEREENS. Back in MiG-1, Bond fiddles with the radio.
Seven to base. I have a full house. Your bid. The situation room erupts in cheers.

head_text.subj: RETURN ON BOND IN THE MIG -

text: By the way: Thank the General for all his "assistance." Over and out.
Goes to AFTERBURNERS. And from the fiery glow of the engi
After credits, fade in on:
All ivy and bricks... And a certain Aston-Martin DB-5, pa
Afterglow: Empty champagne bottle. Rumpled sheets on a sl Bond is in bed with a smart, IRONIC, (and, yes, stunning, Chinese woman, JENNY WU. (NOTE: The Chinese here is Manda phonetically.)
(running a finger across her lips)
... And what do you call these?
Ja-shwa tsway. These are lips.
Indeed they are. (kisses them, lightly)
Deadly little things. She laughs. His hand goes beneath the sheets.
And what do you call these? The Gang of Two?
(smacking his hand, laughing:)
Stop it!
I was just getting to the interesting part!
We've already done the interesting part. Do you forget?
Remind me. He moves to roll on top of her, but she pushes him off, t
Sakwa!
Is that Mandarin, or Cantonese?
Mandarin. You jerk. (tousling his hair)
I'm late. I have to get dressed. She hops off the bed, leaving frame. Bond settles back on headboard, ready to enjoy the view... When his CELL PHONE
(lightly)
Hello - (catching himself)
Hello. INT. M'S ANTEROOM - MI-6. MONEYPENNY, at her desk.
Hello, James. I hope I'm interrupting something important.
(Jenny has a leg on the bed, pulling on a full Victoria's outfit: Nylons, garter/suspenders, bustier, etc.)
Not at all, Moneypenny. I was just brushing up on a little Chinese. (In the background, Jenny insists "I am not little.")
I'm sure she is, James. But I'm afraid you'll have to 'kiss off' the rest of your lessons this afternoon.
(mock chagrin)
Moneypenny... Here I was, finally getting a feel for a new tongue -
Four o'clock. M will meet you in the conference room. Bond watches with amusement as Jenny Wu slips a Graduatio over the lingerie. No dress.
4:30. It may take me a little longer to wrap things up here.
Four o'clock. Don't be late.
(hanging up:)
Tsi tien, Chien-penny.
Ah, James. You always were a cunning linguist... Au revoir, mon cher. Moneypenny hangs up, looks up, and blanches: M is standin
Don't ask.
Don't tell. (walking away)
I don't want to know.
Bond and Jenny Wu emerge from the office. (She's still in They pass a flock of young students:
Good afternoon, Professor Wu.
Good afternoon. (then to Bond)
Are you sure you can't stay for the lecture?
I can't. But I did enjoy the dress rehearsal. She gives him a wry glance, opens a door to a lecture hal
Tsi tien, Mr. Bond.
Tsi tien, Professor Wu. She exits; Bond walks off, passing underneath a WALL MOUN ON THE TV SET - The HNN Globe Logo - The Harmsway News Ne spins into view, followed by:
You're watching HNN, the Harmsway 24 hour news network. Coming up: (mortise shot of:)
Valentin Zukofsky's stunning victory in the Ukrainian Presidential elections... (mortise shot of:)
Live coverage of the latest HNN communications satellite launch from Xichang (shi-chung) China... And - (mortise shot of:)
A special report on the situation in Hong Kong, since the Chinese take- over from Great Britain.
The DB-5 drives past the guard.
Debriefing: Bond, M, and several others listen as NATO CO DOMINIQUE EVERHART, (early 30's, Belgian,) refers to vide the Khyber Pass sequence:

To sum up: After analyzing the tire inflation of the fork-lift in the MI-6 video tape, NATO believes the "red box contains approximately eighty kilograms of U235 weapons grade uranium - an incredibly hard, incredibly heavy, incredibly lethal substance.
And that's enough enriched uranium to produce how many nuclear devices?
Depending on the builder's sophistication - one crude bomb that could devastate London, Paris, New York, Berlin - or all four if they have the latest technology. There's a pregnant pause in the room.
And the participants?
(pointing at the screen)

Kim Dae Yung. Moscow-trained North Korean nuclear weapons specialist; apparently fell out of favor with the current North Korean regime after a botched attempt to steal fissionable material from a British light-water reactor in South Africa - an accident that left him entirely hairless... Another face appears on the screen: COL. DOMINIQUE EVERHART (cont'd)

And Rendera Sikrahm, also known as Richard Stamper. Freelance mercenary, Laos and Cambodia. His father was from Nepal - a Ghurka warrior - con- scripted by the British government to fight in China during World War II - after which the family settled in Hong Kong, where the young Stamper was undoubtedly treated like a second class citizen by both the Hong Kong Chinese, and local British. (beat, aside:)
We've all read about the signs at the British swimming pools in Hong Kong that said "No Ghurka's allowed."
Nothing like a little imperialism to promote loyalty among the faithful.
(stifles a smile, then:)

In conclusion: Both these men have a vendetta against the world. They are nuclear armed, and dangerous. And having failed to get the UZ35 through the old opium route - the Khyber Pass - it's NATO's belief that their next attempt will be through Bulgaria - where the NATO Nuclear Strike Force will be there to stop them.
Thank you Colonel Everhart. (stands, turns to:)
007, I'd like to see you in my office. Why don't you and the Colonel exchange numbers if you need more information?
Yes, M. M exits. Bond approaches Dominique. She smiles, warmly. T mutual attraction - but there's something else going on,
Interesting presentation.
Interesting video tape.
They point, I shoot.
(feels her pockets)
Do you have a pen? I just got promoted and don't have my new cards yet.
Of course. Bond hands her a PEN. She regards it cautiously.
... Does this do anything?
Depends what number you write. She gives him a wry look; starts to write. He notes her W
Married?
Happily.
... Kids?
Three. You? Married?
No.
(smiles)
I didn't think so. For an instant, something crosses Bond's face: Bitterswee morse? Either way, she's scored a subtle victory.
Here. I gave you my assistant's phone number. If it's urgent, she knows where to reach me.
Thanks. (beat, holding her gaze)
Take care -
You too. With a Sphinx-like smile, she watches Bond leave.
Where Bond encounters MONEYPENNY, also walking to M's off
Moneypenny! We've got to stop meeting like this. They may be on to us.
Hello, James. Enjoy your meeting?

In the darkest moments, it's what I live for. Especially since I've heard how much you like to watch... On the hidden camera. Moneypenny cuts Bond a look - and, in the background, see leave the conference room, and walk down the hall, away f
By the way, James: Ordinarily I would never ask, but... Weren't you and that Colonel once stranded on a raft for two weeks in the Sargasso Sea?
Moneypenny! How indiscreet! Have you ever known me to kiss and tell? They've come to a security door. She punches in a code -
Actually, I've never known you to do either... But -
- We all want what we can't have?
Not all of us, 007. The door opens. They go into:
What - no lust for adventure?
No, 007. It's just that I've learned from personal experience - that when we get what we want - (beat)
Somehow the reality is never as... Satisfying as the fantasy. Bond scowls. Moneypenny smiles wryly, points to the inner
Don't keep M waiting.
M is behind her desk; MINISTER PETER JOHNSTONE sits acros handed Teflon-coated politician, with the survival instin plutonium. They've been arguing.
Come in, 007. You know the Minister?
Of course. (nods to)
Minister Johnstone.
Bond sits in an armchair. M presses a button, and a video ELIOT HARMSWAY appears on the wall behind her. Mid-50's,
Tell me, 007, what do you know about Elliot Harmsway?
(quipping)
Only what I read in the newspapers.
(disdainfully)
His newspapers?
(glancing sideways)
Occasionally, yes. (directly to M)
British media mogul. Born in Hong Kong; controls newspapers, TV, radio, cable, satellites; books, magazines, movies, computer software. Theme parks.
(holding up a copy of:)
- Along with Tomorrow - the first world-wide newspaper. Circulation 27 million. Daily. -
'Able to topple governments with a single story' - as he says in his press.
(hurrumph)
Exactly. Bond looks at Johnstone quizzically. Then a very tight-li senses he's about to enter a minefield:
... What's Harmsway done?
It seems, 007, we've received a tip
A rumor - from an anonymous source -
- that Sir Elliot may be involved with Stamper and Yung, and the missing Uranium.
Hearsay. Idle chatter from a source you can't identify - who insists on talking only to 007. Nothing but loose talk and innuendo.

That may be the case at present, Minister Johnstone... But our own sources suspect that Mr. Harmsway used his considerable Russian media - holdings to elect Valentin Zukofsky President of the Ukraine - in trade for the uranium. (M has punched a button, and Valentin's video bio has app
More scurrilous, unsubstantiated gossip.
Perhaps. But it does explain how an ex-KGB agent turned illegal-arms dealer is suddenly portrayed as a long-time friend of the people. (beat)
If you believe what you read in the papers.
(annoyed)

Need I remind the two of you that Elliot Harmsway - Sir Elliot Harmsway - is directly descended from the Earl of Aberdeen? That his Scottish ancestors practically invented Hong Kong - and out of sheer gratitude, Queen Victoria herself named the port "Aberdeen Harbor" in their honor?
(long pause, then:)

... No more than I need remind you, Minister, that merely being a member of the lucky sperm club - does not preclude one from a life of criminal activity. Johnstone is reeling. M continues, to Bond, with aplomb:
The reason I invited the Minister here, 007, was to reassure him that this investigation will be handled with the utmost discretion.
Of course.
Which is also why I've withheld this information from NATO and our allies.
(nods, then, recalling)
... Didn't we once investigate Harmsway?

Yes. 1988. He was furious at the British plan to return Hong Kong, and supposedly started his own negotiations with the Chinese Government. The inquiry went nowhere - but it did earn MI-6 a rather powerful enemy -
Not to mention the chaos it caused at Whitehall when his newspapers began screaming for the recall of the sitting government.
(a beat, then:)
I'm sending you to Venice, 007. You're to check out the source, determine whether Elliot Harmsway is involved with the enriched uranium, and, if so, stop him.
How will I meet the informant? She hands Bond a CARNIVAL MASK:
You're to wear this mask at the Venice Carnival, and wait to be contacted.
I understand.
(standing, to leave)
There is one last thing, 007: Elliot Harmsway is vital to the economic interests of this nation. He's also a major contributor to the party. I expect him to be given every consideration.
Political considerations?
To the best of my recollection, Mr. Bond, I suggested no such thing. (beat, at the door)
In fact, I was never here. And he exits. M, frowning, hits a button on her intercom:
Would you send in the new man from equipment branch?
Right away.
.... I hate to ask, but... Did you ever think you'd miss Communism?
We serve the interests of the British people, 007. No matter who we may be foolish enough to elect. Bond is silent, chastised. M looks away, then looks back:
But if Elliot Harmsway is involved with that uranium, I want him prosecuted to the ends of the earth.
Hopefully, it won't get that far. M looks up: MALCOLM SAUNDERS, Q's successor, limps in, lo mummy - plaster casts on his left leg, left arm; neck-bra
Come in, Saunders.
Okay, Saunders. What is it this time? Rocket in the leg? Machine pistol in the arm?
Q's retirement party. I'd just put the knife into the cake, and -
Come on. I know better than that - Bond thwacks the crutch against the leg. Saunders GRIMACE
It must do something.
Well... If you insist. Saunders flexes his broken arm; ARMORED SPIKES pop out of
The die is cast. Saunders exchanges a beleaguered glance with M. He takes and neck-brace, and places a BRIEFCASE on M's desk.
Now pay attention, 007. We haven't much time to demonstrate your new Q toys.
How is old Q?
Gone fishing.
Fishing?
Big game fishing. (beat)
Sonar torpedoes. Retirement gift from his friends at the CIA. Saunders has opened the briefcase. Bond tries to look ins Saunders repositions it. Saunders continues:
In the meantime, perhaps this will spark your interest. (takes out a disposable lighter)
Cigarette lighter. Thumb here, press here - A small flame appears. Bond, unimpressed, reaches for it
Saunders, I've lit cigarettes -
Not from forty feet. Saunders flips the lighter sideways and - WHOOSH! A burst shoots across the room.
The disposable lighter also contains a small self-detonation charge (beat)
Depending on who - or what - you wish to dispose of. Bond takes the lighter, begins to play with it...
Stop fidgeting, 007. Next - He takes out a pair of SHOELACES.
... Shoelaces?
Plastique explosive shoelaces. (holding them out at length)
Cut them to regulate the size of the blast; totally harmless until you attach the detonator hidden in the heel of your shoe.
(examining them curiously)
Perfect way to tie up a... 'Knotty' problem?
(frowns)
Moving along - (he produces:)
A typical plastic security card. Name here, magnetic information stripe here - (pointing to)
And a code breaking microprocessor here. Swipe it through any card reader - anywhere - you're in.
Does it work on cash machines? Saunders is suddenly stricken. Flustered. He blurts out:
It was an authorized test. I returned the money.
(amused)
I see...
(ignoring this)
Finally, your new watch: Blue laser here for signaling or burning through locks; press this button, the sweep hand becomes a Geiger counter.
(needling him)
If you can't do the time, don't do the crime?
(smirks at Bond, pauses, then)
Oh. I almost forgot. There is one last thing: Before Q retired, he asked that I give you one other protective device. He hands Bond a WEDDING BAND.
A wedding band??? What am I supposed to be able to do with this?
I believe Q's exact words were: (imitating Q, emphatically:)
"Hopefully, nothing." Bond turns from Saunder's devious grin to an amused M. Sm
...I'll give you a ring from Venice.
Good luck on your mission, 007. He snaps the ring down on her desk.
Till death do us part.

A GLEAMING WHITE YACHT - with two on-board helicopters, a tarped hold - dominates the harbor. (Harmsway's SEA DOLPH Tonight, however, we find a GONDOLA, gliding through the Arriving at a festively-lit dock, crowded with gaily cost partygoers and musicians in medieval garb. Wearing the mask from M's office, (and a bright blue cape alights the gondola, and plunges into the crowd.

A swirl of colors, noise and music. Pushing his way into celebration, Bond scans the crowd, looking for a face: NOTHING BUT A SEA OF MASKS. White. Yellow. Red. Blue. Caught up in the tumult, he turns left, he strains to tur anxiously looking for the contact. Who is it? THREE MASKED WOMEN appear in front of Bond. They curtsy,
Buona sera, signore - He's spun by a MASKED MAN with a bottle.

Vino? Bond waves him off - and is jostled in the other directio group of celebrants carrying a long banner. Suddenly, the CROWD SURGES FORWARD: A PROCESSION, carryin EFFIGY OF CARNIVAL is making its way through the square. Locked shoulder to shoulder in the crowd, Bond struggles forward - left, right - when he FEELS A TUG at his cape f He can only crane his neck to see/hear -
I may have been followed. Meet me at the Church in five minutes! With an effort, Bond turns to look at her - but sees noth the wisp of a satin costume, disappearing as the crowd cl behind him.

Five minutes later. Almost deserted. A few stray couples. MASKED WOMAN appears, walking tentatively between the sha the moonlight, looking for Bond. Suddenly - Whomp! - an arm reaches out, and yanks her into an alcove
Looking for someone? Recovering her breath (it was a violent yank,) the woman removes her mask. She shines a sexy, 1000-watt smile at 0
Hello, James. Bond reacts. He is not happy to see her.
Paris?!? What are you doing here?
Is that any way to say hello?
I thought your specialty was good-bye. Paris smiles coyly. She LIFTS A HAND to tousle his hair -
Oh, James. I've missed you -
(grabbing her by the wrist)
Is this another one of your games?
Stop it! You're hurting me! Can't you just be nice?
I've got half the British government breathing down my neck. I don't have time for your nonsense. She's surprised - and hurt - by his coldness.
Don't you even miss me? Didn't I mean anything to you?
Nothing. She turns away from him, fighting back tears. Bond doesn'
What about Elliot Harmsway? Or is this just another one of your stunts?
(anguished)
No! He's crazy - he's insane. He hates everybody. He's got these plans - (facing Bond, becoming hysterical:)
You've got to help me, James. I'm sorry. I'm sorry for everything. I know I was wrong - but you've got to protect me. I know you still love - BOND SLAPS HER. She's stunned. He waits. She's angered:
Do you feel better now?
(not giving an inch)
Do you? She turns away. Bond feels remorse for hitting her. Softe
What about the uranium?
It's on the boat. He's holding a press conference tomorrow. Bond reaches out to touch her. She falls into his arms, b face in his shoulder.
I'm so sorry, James. I promise, I'll never leave you again.
(patting her head)
Shhhhh...
Just hold me. Bond thinks for a moment, then gently pushes her away, a backwards, to look in her eyes:
How do you know Harmsway? Paris' eyes flicker at something over Bond's shoulder. Sh
Kiss me. She pulls Bond to her, kissing him - then HAULS OFF, BELT across the mouth.
Bastard! Leave me alone! She shoves him off, darts away. Bond is bleeding from his and not altogether surprised at her behavior. He turns to

Paris running to FOUR MEN dressed alike in three-corner h enveloped from head-to-foot in BLACK CAPES. Their faces a completely concealed behind flat, bone-white masks coveri their chins. They look like messengers of death.
The leader is STAMPER; the others are locals, THUG #1, #2 #1 is built like a bank vault.) Stamper looks steadily at
Who is he?
Nobody. Just some drunk. Leave him alone -
(to Thug #3)
Take her to the boat.
He sees STAMPER and the TWO HENCHMEN approaching. He turn quickly toward -

Pushing past carnival-goers, Bond rushes up the central s the bridge. At the top, looking onto the main span, he se THE EFFIGY OF CARNIVAL PROCESSION, approaching like a tid BOND throws a look over his shoulder, and SEES THE THREE up the stairs, knocking people out of the way like bowlin completely unaware of the oncoming parade at the top. BOND turns to face the men... And suddenly THROWS HIS CAP dramatically, like Batman - blocking their view of the pr STAMPER AND THE TWO THUGS hesitate for a moment - And BOND PULLS THE CAPE TO HIS BODY, just as the PROCESSI PAST HIM, and spills down the stairs, overwhelming Stampe
(to himself, flexing the cape)
So that's how he does it. Bond disappears into the oncoming crowd. Stamper and Thug #2 are pushed to the bottom of the stair Thug #1 bulls his way up, shouldering through the crowd.

As Bond nears the bottom of the staircase, he looks back THUG #1 is coming down the stairs like an infernal machin carnival-goers aside like rag-dolls. Spotting Bond, he ch But gets caught between TWO MEN CARRYING A SATIN BANNER. right through it - ripping the material apart with his ba pulling the men down, after him.

Bond turns past the wall at the bottom of the colonnade. A GROUP OF TOURISTS, posing for a photo by the bridge - and just beyond this - A STREET SELLER hawking souvenirs from a PUSH CART. BOND approaches the TOURIST with the camera, offering to picture for him.
Prego, prego. Permissio.

Grazie. Bond takes the camera. The tourists pose. And with perfec Bond turns, and - POP! - sets off the FLASHBULB in THUG # just as he comes around the corner. Bond flips the camera back to the tourist -

Grazie - And heads for the PUSHCART. Wheeling it around, he SHOVES thug, who is still stumbling, blinded by the flashbulb. The CART SLAMS INTO THE MAN, knocking him on his back. Th stops on top of him, pinning him down. BOND takes off, threading through the crowd toward a SIDE Meanwhile, THE STREET SELLER rushes to his wrecked cart. in the air as Thug #1 jumps to his feet. He's getting rea off. He looks around for Bond - just catching a glimpse o 007 disappears down the sidestreet. Thug #1 makes a bee-line for Bond - but finds his path bl MOTORCYCLISTS, chatting away. Barely stopping, Thug #1 li the motorcycles - with the driver still in the seat - and INTO THE CANAL.

text: Stamper and Thug #2 arrive at the wrecked cart - in time #1 disappear onto the side Street. Stamper motions for Thug #2 to come with him on a paralle along the canals toward -

Shrinking back into the shadows, Bond peers out into the
Stamper and Thug 2 charge in. Bond watches as they split start looking for him.

Suddenly, a huge hand grabs 007's shoulder, spinning him THUG #1 has Bond in his grasp, with murder his eyes. In o move, Bond side-steps, ducks, and twists out of the cloak it over the Thug's head. And as the Thug struggles to get under it, Bond slams him head-first into a wall, knocking (He's left sitting upright, slumped against the wall.)
Bond heads off down the alleyway, away from the Plaza, to courtyard of Il Bovolo.

Thug #2 enters, spots the figure in Bond's cloak. Very qu pulls out his gun, kneels... And as he brings the gun up cloaked figure's head, chambering a round - The cloak erupts, with Thug #1 viciously biting Thug #2's hurling him against the opposite wall. With a frustrated fury, Thug #1 rips off the cloak, and s
Marco - I didn't know -
After him! They charge off.
Bond enters from the alley, scans the courtyard: Three wa way out... Save for a SPIRAL STAIRCASE that leads up to t FLOOR INTERIOR BALCONY, overlooking the courtyard.
Bond takes the marble steps, two at a time.
The two Thugs enter the square. Motioning for quiet, they BOND'S FOOTFALLS on the steps, and race up after him.

Coming off the staircase, Bond tries the doors to the int building: Locked. Too heavy to burst in. He glances down courtyard, and HEARS THE THUGS' FOOTSTEPS running up the Bond glances up to the roof, just above his head: The onl Pocketing his mask, Bond hops on the BANISTER, REACHES fo GUTTER. He pulls himself up, throws a leg over - onto the disappears from sight... Just as the Thugs enter the balcony from the staircase.
Bond scurries along the steeply pitched terra-cotta roof. SHEER DROPS on three sides - but the fourth side is a one to an adjoining building. Bond jumps.

007 lands on another steeply pitched roof; unable to get on the tiles, he slides down, rolling to the edge. He loo The adjoining building is one story lower, with a skyligh As Bond struggles to climb back to the peak of the second
Thug #1 holsters his gun, and climbs on the banister. He' to climb onto the roof by himself - so Thug #2 shoves him
Thug #1 searches for Bond. He HEARS BOND moving, below hi next building. He makes a running leap.

Bond has hauled himself up to a crouch as Thug #1 lands. grapple. The Thug sends Bond sliding down toward the edge roof, then loses his balance, and slides down after Bond. AT THE EDGE OF THE ROOF, Bond is about to slide off, onto skylight below, but GRABS THE COPPER GUTTER at the last m 007 is now hanging, fifteen feet above a glass skylight.. tumbles off the edge of the roof, and saves himself by GR BOND'S LEGS. They sway in the air for a second. The GUTTER bends, brea two of them fall -

text: They land in a shower of glass on the grand banquet table Great Hall. Bond is winded. Thug #1, unfazed. He grabs Bo collar, hauling him up on his feet. Thug #1 shoves the nose of his gun under Bond's chin, for on his toes. Snarling, he thrusts his face menacingly clo

I owe you some pain. With lightning speed, Bond: 1) Grasps the Thug's elbow an gun arm forward, as, 2) Bond pitches his head back. Bond' clears the barrel as THE GUN FIRES INTO THE CEILING. The flash momentarily blinds Thug #1. Bond snatches a CAN and smashes it against the Thug's arm, knocking the gun a As BOND DRAWS HIS WALTHER, the Thug grabs Bond's wrist, a (yet effortlessly) SQUEEZES THE GUN from 007's hand, ONTO With a sick smile, the Thug tosses Bond into a corner of He's having fun.

head_text.subj: AS BOND STAGGERS, PICKING HIMSELF UP FROM THE CORNER -

text: THUG #1 tosses aside a massive table and chairs to get at BOND shoves a SUIT OF ARMOR (on wheels) at Thug #1 - who of the way, like a gnat. Concerned this might be getting serious, BOND grabs an OA the shattered table. He wields it like a bat, to ward off Unimpressed, the THUG SMASHES HIS FIST INTO a GLASS DISPL and plucks out a CLAYMORE - a two-handed "King Arthur" ty With one roundhouse blow, THUG #1 SLICES BOND'S TABLE LEG The Thug swings the Claymore a second time, forcing Bond

filled with pole weapons. Bond snatches a lethal-looking (Ax, fluke and spike on a staff.) Thug #1 stops in his tr Drops the Claymore. Grabs a pole-ax. THE TWO MEN face off in a short, furious battle, which en #1 shattering Bond's Halberd with the pole-ax.

Gripping the pole-ax horizontally in both hands, Thug #1 backward, to a SECOND DISPLAY WALL that features AN IRON (Something like a hinged sarcophagus, lined with spikes.) Thug #1 tries to push 007 into the case, but Bond side-st last minute. Thug #1 lurches forward, and is only stopped killing himself by the pole-ax hitting the sides of the i As Thug #1 steps back, Bond grabs a MORNING-STAR from the studded iron ball on a chain attached to a club) Bond swings the Morning-Star down, SNAPPING THUG #1'S POL TWO... But loses the weapon in the process. Now, Thug #1 lunges for Bond's throat. Grappling, they sl wall next to the IRON MAIDEN - which is STARTING TO COME THE LEATHER STRAPS holding it upright.  - In a near death-grip, Bond manages to push/kick/smash Thu backwards, down onto the floor.

head_text.subj: AND AS BOND REACHES UP FOR ANOTHER WEAPON
BOND CAN'T GET THE HAND-AX OFF THE WALL. HE TURNS TO SEE

text: And at the very last second, BOND DISLODGES THE HAND-AX, IRON MAIDEN'S LEATHER RETAINING STRAPS and -

head_text.subj: FROM INSIDE THE IRON MAIDEN'S POV -

text: The iron maiden falls forward, impaling Thug #1 on the wo
The Iron Maiden covers all of Thug #1, except for his arm clutching Bond's gun. Bond bends down and retrieves it.
He fought hard... (holstering the gun)
But the case was terminal. And on this note, we -
Under a beautiful blue sky, the gleaming white SEA DOLPHI dock, festooned with pennants and banners. There's a crow At the same time, however, 500 feet away...
Bond meets with Signore DiGIACOMO, a middle-aged Italian official in shirtsleeves. Two underlings hover in the bac
You've confirmed all the legal details with M? DiGIACOMO
Si. Bueno. She's very... 'Competent.' ...For a woman.
Let's go over this one more time. DiGIACOMO
You will investigate the boat. You'll signal us if you find the enriched uranium. And then - (distracted)
Pardon. He looks at a WOMAN who has appeared with a baby in her a
Don Franco. I just want to say we're voting for you in the election. DiGIACOMO (teasing, re: the baby)
Both of you?
(laughs)
Of course. DiGIACOMO
Grazie, grazie. Ciao. She leaves. He turns back Bond: DiGIACOMO
So. You'll signal us if you find the uranium -
And you'll wait until after the press conference - and everyone is gone - before you board the boat and arrest him. DiGIACOMO
Perfecto. Then we turn him over to you, and the English government puts him on a military transport back to London. Bond nods, looks over at the Sea Dolphin II. DiGIACOMO
Do not worry, my friend. I only want what is best. For both of us. Bond stands to leave. DiGiacomo smiles after 007 - as if savoring some private secret. He snaps his fingers to an DiGIACOMO
Rocco! Un Cappuccino!

As Bond makes his way up the gangplank - ELLIOT HARMSWAY is holding a press conference near the bo ed by dignitaries. He is a man with an EVIL EUPHORIA - sh all the charm and charisma that's made him one of the wor powerful media tycoons.

...And so, it's somewhat fitting that we are here today... To christen this environmental research boat in Venice - - 'Venezia' - the port where Marco Polo sailed forth to explore the world's great uncharted oceans... (beat)

That 2/3 of the earth's surface where the sharks are not working members of the press. Laughter. Bond studies the man. Harmsway continues, point LARGE DRILL/BORING OBJECT, the size of a jet engine, atta long flexible hose/tube.

With our six custom designed sea-bed coring drills, we will probe the long-term effects of pollution; our sonars, radars, and research labs will study the wind, the water, and the sea life that so dearly feeds us. Bond moves through the crowd. He spots a bulkhead, with a

And so, in the spirit of international cooperation - thanking my good friend, Valentin Zukofsky - the newly elected President of the Ukraine for all his assistance - He motions to Zukofsky, who nods to the audience...
I give this boat to mankind - selflessly - in pure charity asking nothing for myself... But the cable TV rights. Big laugh from the assemblage. Harmsway turns to a BEAUTY
Miss Venice? If you'll do the honors - SMASH! She cracks a champagne bottle on the tip of the bo
Now I'll take some questions from the press - even the few of you who aren't on my payroll. Laughter. Harmsway points to a reporter:
Mr. Harmsway: Why did you name this boat the Sea Dolphin II?
Actually, my first choice was 'No Comment.' So if someone asked where I was, I could truthfully respond 'No Comment.' (laughter; he points)
Over there.
Sir Elliot: Is it true you're in negotiations to move your offices from Hong Kong to Kuala Lumpur?
(impishly)
No comment. Amidst more laughter, Bond disappears into the bulkhead d

Bond moves cautiously down a STAIRCASE... And peers along a CORRIDOR. He sees a GUARD, checking doo sure they're locked. Bond withdraws for a moment, looks b guard is at the far end of the hall. He lifts a WALKIE-TA

Level one, secure. The guard exits, down another staircase. Bond moves steal the corridor, glancing at signs on various doors: FISH HA WEATHER STATION, CREW'S MESS, etc... Until he comes to: METALLURGY LAB. There's a CARD READER by the door. Bond s his Q-toy, swipes it. Click. He goes inside.

Bond clocks the lab: Power tools, test benches, a SECOND DOOR... And in the middle of the room - THE RED BOX. Quickly, (as the echoes of Harmsway's press conference ca through the portholes,) Bond examines the edges of the bo for tamper-proof seals. Finds none. Gingerly, he opens it URANIUM SLUGS. They look like black tennis ball canisters BOND presses a button on his watch: THE GEIGER COUNTER CL Bond pauses. Wants to make sure. He spots ANOTHER GEIGER a bench; he moves its probe over the uranium slugs: Same Bond closes the box. He decides to check out the rest of examining gadgets, tools, chemicals. HE OPENS A SHALLOW D And finds a set of BLACK ROTARY CUTTING SAWS, WITH ELONGA (They look almost like a series of sharks' jaws - one ova another ) Bond lifts one - surprised at its extreme weight. He wond is used for. Just then - THERE'S A CLICK AT THE SECOND DOOR. Bond quickly replaces cutting saw, moves to the first door - And as the SECOND DOOR OPENS, Bond slips out the first, i CORRIDOR, down the hall, heading for the stairs.

YUNG enters, his hairless head shining under the lights. around, sensing something is wrong. Glances: Not the red the Geiger counter. But then he notices it: THE DRAWER is sticking out, maybe a sixteenth of an inch. Yung picks up a telephone.
Bond emerges from the bulkhead door. The press conference up. As Bond makes his way to the RAIL, looking out on the

The maiden voyage begins tonight. I have some business in London - but the ship will sail down the Nile, across the South China Sea, stopping in Australia, winding up in San Francisco. Bond stands at the rail, AIMS HIS WATCH at the cafe - HARMSWAY (cont'd)
But having said that - let's get to the real business - the only thing that attracts newsmen faster than a breaking story the free food and beverage.
DiGiacomo sees the BLUE LASER. Motions his men to action.

head_text.subj: RETURN ON THE SEA DOLPHIN II

text: Bond has sauntered to one of the hospitality bars, trying ac inconspicuous as possible. A hand clasps his shoulder:
Mr. James Bond! Bond spins to see Valentin, surrounded by the usual assor cheaply dressed goons.
Valentin. What an unpleasant surprise.
What is it that brings you to Venezia, Mr. Bond? Business - (sly glance to the thugs)

Or somebody else's business? The goons chortle. Bond isn't happy with this attention. a VIDEO SURVEILLANCE CAMERA ON ONE OF THE MASTS, scanning A WOMAN'S SHRILL WHINING VOICE - brings Bond back to Vale is very colorfully dressed - dripping in high-ticket logo
Dimitri!!! You promised I could go shopping!!
(sotto, to Bond)
New mistress. (to her, impatiently)
So? Go!
I need money. Valentin gives a beleaguered shrug, and pulls out a HUGE
Here. Take an inch. Shaking his head, Valentin turns back to Bond:
Come. Let me buy you a drink. It's free. With Bond keeping an eye on the surveillance camera, they several steps to the bar.
(to the bartender)
Two vodka martini's. Shaken. Not stirred. (to Bond)
And you? Bond would rather not drink - but knows that any change f regular behavior might arouse suspicion.
One. As the bartender pours:
I must say, Valentin, capitalism seems to be treating you well.
(belting one back)
I used to sell weapons; now I buy votes. (then)
Off the record.
Of course. If you can't beat the government, you might as well own it. Valentin spots someone off-camera.
Wait - I want you to meet a friend of mine. (calling out)
Elliot! Elliot! Come here. Harmsway appears. Ebullient as ever.
Elliot Harmsway, I want to introduce you to an old friend -
(putting out a hand to shake)
The name is Bond. James Bond. Harmsway greets Bond with a warm smile. Yet his words are
Always nice to meet one of her Majesty's fellow subjects... (a nod to Valentin)
Especially one with such distinguished friends.
You might say I've always been one of Mr. Valentin's biggest followers.
(chortling)
'Biggest followers?' He's practically made a career' of it!! He laughs. Bond decides to pull Harmsway's chain.
It's a beautiful boat, Sir Elliot. Practically glows in the dark.
(smiles)
I can tell you're a man with an eye for exquisite possessions, Mr. Bond. (signaling off camera)
Darling! Come here. (beat)
I want you to meet my wife. A woman appears in frame, her face obscured by a large su she reveals her face to the camera - and Bond -
Paris Harmsway, allow me to introduce you to James Bond. There is a terrified look on her face. Harmsway continues his most insinuating smile:
But then... I believe you two have already met. There is a beat - an uncomfortable moment when nobody spe
The entire party turns to see DiGIACOMO barging his way u gangplank - wearing a ludicrous military uniform, trailed TOTING CARBINIERI, along with his own VIDEO AND STILL CRE DiGIACOMO
Elliot Harmsway: Under the auspices of the Italian government, I, Franco DiGiacomo - (pauses; smiles at a camera; POP! A flash goes off)
Am arresting you for the illegal possession of weapons grade enriched uranium. (to his underlings)
Seize the boat! A set of frozen glances goes from Bond, to Paris, to Harm
I think I suddenly remembered an urgent meeting in Moscow. To everyone's surprise, Harmsway guffaws.
My friends, there's been a terrible mistake. (putting his arm around DiGiacomo)
Come. Let me show you. And he leads the procession off, through the bulkhead doo left with Paris. She is white with fear. Bond moves to co
Paris -
Leave me alone! He's going to kill me!!
Why didn't you tell me? Why wasn't it in our files?
(anguished)
He didn't want anyone to know. He kept it out of the papers. He said a third wife was bad for his image. (beat)
You've got to protect me! Bond wants to help her - and follow Harmsway. He pulls ou
Go to my hotel room. I'll be there in twenty minutes. Paris looks up at him like a hurt child. She wants some c wants to hear him say 'I love you.'
Just - say it. Say it just once.
(pauses, discomfited)
One thing at a time. I'll see you in twenty minutes. Go. She exits; he goes to the bulkhead door... And we pan up SURVEILLANCE CAMERA, following him.
Harmsway holds court near the red box. Bond squeezes in.
I believe this is what you're looking for, Colonel. He opens the red box. Hoists out a canister.
Is it uranium? Absolutely. But watch - (runs the Geiger counter over it)
It's depleted uranium! Completely safe! A child could sleep on it. Bond can't believe what he's seeing. DiGiacomo is mortifi
I received it from the Russian government - a by-product of their nuclear arms program - in the hopes that I could create tools for oceanographic research. (beat)
It's what I was talking about: 'Swords into plowshares'! The Sprit of International Cooperation! DiGIACOMO
Signore Harmsway. A thousand apologies. (snaps his fingers to a lackey:)
Give him the video tape.
Please. No harm done, Don Franco. Go upstairs, and enjoy the reception. As the room empties, he calls -
Oh - Mr. Bond. One minute. Bond approaches him. They're the only people in the room.
I hope you've enjoyed this little charade.
Which part? The Colonel's? Or yours?
(icily)
A piece of advice, Mr. Bond: Don't screw with a man who buys ink by the ton. (beat)
It's deadlier than uranium.
(staring him down)
We'll see about that. Harmsway glances at his watch. Smiles coldly.
Aren't you late for a meeting?
Bond rushes down the gangplank, along the dock. Jumps in
The Danielli. Presto!
Harmsway closes the door. Yung is there.
That was too close.
Don't worry. Mr. Bond will get the message. So will his boss. Harmsway presses a button - and suddenly the red box lift second red box appears underneath it, like shuffling a de
I'm going to the plane. Tell the captain to set sail at once.
Bond jumps out of the gondola, sprints into the lobby.
Bond appears, rushing up a staircase. He comes to his doo closed, but unlocked.
Bond enters the room. Looks around, calling out -
Paris? Paris? He sees the French doors open onto the canal. The curtain outward. Bond rushes to the window and looks down:
Paris Harmsway is dead, floating in the water.
Crushed. Devastated. And to make matters worse: DiGIACOMO'S VOICE
Signore Bond? Bond turns. A flashbulb goes off, capturing Bond and DiGi DiGIACOMO
You're under arrest.
The HMS INDOMITABLE - a 3,300 ton British frigate, surges water, heading toward the setting sun.
BATTLE-DRESSED ROYAL MARINES patrol the deck; GUNNERY CRE weapons. Whatever is going on here, it's not business as
Close on A VERTICAL GLASS MAP. An electronic panel displa BLINKING YELLOW DOT indicates -
We've cleared Hong Kong harbor, sir. THE CAPTAIN nods. Turns to the GPS OFFICER:
Position? The GPS officer enters keyboard commands on console marke POSITIONING SATELLITE." He reads out the data:
Two-two, zed-three, one-five north; a hundred fourteen degrees, five minutes, ten seconds east.
Mark.
Locked on satellite, sir.
Set course, two-ten degrees, south south east.
Coming about, sir. The Captain is all business - clipped, sober terse. Turns FIRST OFFICER, hands him a SLIP OF PAPER:
Orders from London: For the next ninety-six hours, we're to run on full radio silence. Double watches, full alert. (beat)
We're to send one encrypted positioning burst to London every six hours - otherwise, zero electronic emissions. The first officer nods. CAPTAIN (cont'd)
Inform the men, then run a surprise inspection. If someone paints us, I don't want this ship showing up on their radar screen like some god-damned Harrod's Christmas tree.
Yes, sir!
I'll be in my cabin until oh-six- hundred hours. The Captain heads for the door.
Captain leaving the bridge. The officers salute as he exits. With a shrug, the FIRST picks up the INTERCOM MICROPHONE:
Attention all hands. Now hear this...
Crowded with CREW MEMBERS eating, waiting on line for foo
We will rig immediately for electronic silence. All electronic gear is to be shut down...
At microwave. His finger hovers over button, then stops. the door of the microwave and takes out a bowl. Dumps the on the stove.
CREW MEMBER with an ELECTRIC SHAVER.
All personal radios, video devices and computers will be stowed at once. He stops shaving.
The ENGINEER shouts to his crew, over NOISE OF DIESEL ENG
Check the engine baffles; rig the generators for shielded operation.
The First Officer stands next to the Communications Offic
Communications set to receive only, sir. The First Officer looks over the shoulder of RATING at ra
Radar switched to passive mode; sonar re-set to low-power operation. (beat)
You couldn't find our signature with a magnifying glass.
Let's hope so. The First Officer joins the Second Officer at the windows the horizon with binoculars.
Looks like we're in for a long, uncomfortable trip.
We'll all breathe a lot easier when we get this cargo back to London.

THE BAGPIPE AND DRUM CORPS of the Royal Highland Regiment "Black Watch") is playing a FUNERAL DIRGE outside a vast with a HARMSWAY NEWS HELICOPTER on the lawn, and LIMOUSIN and a FLOWER CAR in the driveway. SIX MEN IN FORMAL MOURNING ATTIRE are entering the house.

A SINGLE WHITE ROSE is added to a pile of white roses in HARMSWAY'S OPEN CASKET. REVEAL: We're in mid-procession: The last two (of the six outside) place roses in the casket... Then turn, nodding sorrowfully to ELLIOT HARMSWAY (sittin front row of a room that's keen turned into a makeshift c And follow hand signals of STAMPER, who motions them THRO to an unseen room. After the last man has paid his respects, HARMSWAY stands the bier, and - wiping away a tear - places a single RED dead wife's casket.

We're in a room that looks as if it could only exist in, James Bond movie: Slick, stark, sterile. Steel, glass, ch The SIX men are seated around a giant conference table, l absurdly out of place in their formal mourning attire. Elliot Harmsway enters, (passing what appears to be the L that hangs in the lobby of CAA,) walks to the head of the takes off his gray mourning gloves, slaps them down, and:
Good morning, Gentlemen. I'm sorry to bring you here under these circumstances, but (beat)
Considering our meeting was already scheduled, this was a happy coincidence. The men nod. Harmsway sits, dims the lights from a contro HARMSWAY (cont'd)
Number One, your report? A gap-toothed Californian with bland features stands.
Sir Elliot: The entertainment division is releasing three new animated children's movies this year. (pause)
By the time we're finished promoting them on our TV, radio, cable, newspaper, and magazine outlets - (pause)

There won't be a parent in the universe who won't feel guilty if they don't take their children to our stores and theme parks to buy the toys, books, video- games and clothing featuring our 'lovable little creatures.' (pause)
We anticipate revenues of 3.1 billion dollars.
Excellent, Number One. Build a better rat-trap, and the world truly will beat a path to your theme park. (turns to)
Number Two? A young guy with glasses gets up, looking remarkably like
As you're aware, Sir Elliot, our software division has introduced a new computer operating system, Gates '99. (beat)
It's deliberately filled with bugs - so people will be forced to buy our upgrades over the next five years. (beat)
The window on revenues is 2.8 billion.
Outstanding, Number Two. (beat, remembering:)
By the way - Number Five - ? (a man looks up)
Who's ahead in the American elections?
The Democrat, sir. By nine points.
Maybe it's time to publish that story about his sex life. Even things up. A close race is always better for our TV ratings.
Consider him slimed, sir.
Splendid. Next... (with noticeable reserve)
Number Three. Your report? A SHORT MIDDLE-EASTERN MAN stands. Nervous.
I regret to inform you, sir, that Saddam Hussein is still demanding a bonus for his role in the Gulf War.
...Haven't we already paid him for his services?

Yes, sir. But he still feels his people should share in the increased profits of our news division. He has proposed an additional 500 million dollar payment. A pause. The other men in the room shift uncomfortably.
... And there's no truth that 10% of that money will go into your Swiss bank account?
No sir! I swear! This is not true!!
You disappoint me, Number Three. Harmsway presses a button. Stamper enters. Number Three a this means death. He BEGS FOR HIS LIFE:
Please sir. Please -
...But because I am a just man, I've decided to give Mr. Hussein what he deserves. Number Three is confused. Does this mean he's going to li
Mr. Stamper will escort you to the plane.
(overwhelmed with gratitude)
Thank you sir! Thank you! Harmsway nods, watching him leave:
Good-bye, Mr. Azziz. And the man is gone. Harmsway turns his attention back to
Let's proceed with new business. Harmsway presses another button. The room darkens. The CE THE TABLE OPENS, and a 3-D MAP OF MALAYSIA rises into vie
Gentlemen: In exactly 36 hours, we are going to initiate phase one of the word's most perfect crime: The biggest theft in the history of mankind. (beat, pointing with a laser)
Right here. In the Strait of Malacca.
Stamper holds the back door open for Number Three. He get
He seems relieved, until the doors lock, ominously. They
Number Three fidgets in the back... And notices Stamper s him in the REARVIEW MIRROR. He sees Stamper reach INTO HI and PANICS! Is he going to get shot? Is it over? He wince

head_text.subj: STAMPER'S HAND SUDDENLY THRUSTS BACKWARD THROUGH THE PART

text: Gum? Shaking his head, he pulls out a HANDKERCHIEF to mop the
Amidst ad-libbed 'good-bye's" from the gang of six (now f Harmsway gets in the waiting HNN chopper. It powers up, t
Stamper's limousine parks near a Gulfstream jet. He opens door for Number Three. At last, the man believes he is sa
Thank you! Thank you so much. You must thank Sir Elliot for me.
(producing a NEWSPAPER)

Here. Something to read on the plane. Stamper TUCKS THE PAPER FIRMLY UNDER #3'S ARM - and gives friendly pat on the back, sending him up the stairs. At the doorway, Number Three looks back. Stamper smiles,
Bye-bye.
Number Three settles into his seat. The door closes; the wind up for take-off. He sighs: He's safe. He casually pi newspaper, snaps open the front page:

Screaming headline: ISRAELI AGENT REVEALED. There's a FUL PHOTO OF NUMBER THREE underneath. Number Three lowers the paper, white as a ghost, and - TWO ARABIAN GENTLEMEN (in full burnoose) sit down on eith him. They smile. And on NUMBER THREE'S BLOOD-CURDLING SCR
Moving through FOG in the STRAIT OF MALACCA, night.

The room is bathed in blue light as the crew monitors the ble's command and control systems. At the VERTICAL GLASS MAP, the ship's course has been cha Hong Kong, south, down around Singapore, then north, wher BLINKING dot indicates it's currently in the Strait of Ma Standing in front of the map, however, THE NAVIGATION OFF perplexed. He's comparing what's on the screen to a piece in his hand. Something is wrong.
... This doesn't make sense. What's our heading now? THE HELMSMAN looks down at his compass/auto-pilot. INSERT COMPASS/AUTO-PILOT - moving from West to North - t on a North position.
Zero one three. Due north. The two officers share a look. Something is odd, but -
We're on course again. Just then, the FIRST OFFICER ENTERS from the exterior bri
Can't see a damn thing in this fog. (calling out)
Rating: What have we got? He joins the RATING and COMMUNICATION'S OFFICERS at their
A passenger ferry and two freighters broadcasting on low-band -
And two small fishing boats about 30k north. No radar, but we've identified their engine signatures. As the First Officer takes this in:
Damn. It's doing it again.
(joining him)
What's wrong?
About every ninety seconds, the auto- pilot jogs us to the west. He points down to the compass/auto-pilot, SWINGING WEST..
Then re-sets us to the north. The compass reaches dead west - then starts to swing back HELMSMAN (cont'd)
The Captain wants us on the East side of the channel. ...Cross current?
Not in the Strait. (to the Navigator)
How's our position?
According to the satellite, we're exactly on course.
Did you check the auto-pilot?
The back-up does the same thing.
Check it again. What about the global positioning satellite? Could there be something wrong with the signal?
Two words: Im-possible.

As the earth turns below, a TINY SILVER DOT appears in th A COMMUNICATIONS SATELLITE, spinning slowly on its axis. It comes closer and closer to camera, until it FILLS THE the LOGO on its body ROTATES INTO VIEW: HNN. THE HARMSWAY NEWS NETWORK.
THE HELMSMAN finishes fiddling with the auto-pilot.
How is it now?
Seems to be back to normal, sir. The First Officer nods... Then HEARS a SHRILL WARNING BEE
I have something off the port bow! The First Officer rushes to join him at the screen. SONAR OPERATOR (cont'd)
100 meters out, just below the surface. (adjusts the controls)
A meter in diameter; ten - twelve meters long. ...Floating vertically?
A dead head. (off the others' quizzical looks)
Water logged timber. Floats straight up. You sometimes see them on the east side of the channel - from the logging camps on Sumatra - but they don't usually float this far west. (calling out)
Muncy! Engines to half!
Aye-aye sir. Engines to half.
(explaining)
Chew up a log like that in the propeller, you end up with enough paperwork to go from here to London. Twice.
The ship is moving towards a DARK VERTICAL SHAPE - Harmsw CORE BORING DRILL (shorthand "THE WORM',) attached to a l dredging pipe.
Motionless, hanging in the water. Then the monster awakes sphere retracts, revealing a wide angle CAMERA LENS.
The Communications Officer reacts to his monitor with ALA
I'm getting an electrical emission, sir! Extremely close. Bearing 240 - The First Officer is surprised. All hell is about to brea
Punch up the radar -
I've got it, sir. A large craft - XX,OOO tons. Range - (disbelief)
200 yards? It's anchored in a cove!
That's impossible! We're in the middle of the channel! A Junior officer bursts in from the exterior bridge:
Breakers off the port bow! We're heading for shore!
Sir -
(reacting to the Jr. Officer)
Full stop!!! Call the captain!
Sir!
(annoyed)
What?!?!
The log is moving!
Propelled by water-jets in its head, THE WORM STREAKS TOW INDOMITABLE, emitting a HIGH PITCHED whine as its drill b to speed. The drill's BLACK TEETH glisten in the water.
Closing in on the hull like a torpedo. It gets closer, pi speed, until - on IMPACT -
A TORRENT OF WATER engulfs the Engineer and Crewmen when bursts/drills through the hull. As they scream, drowning A CREWMAN ON THE GANTRY scrambles up, one step ahead of t through a bulkhead, into -
Where the CREWMAN and TWO OPERATORS struggle to CLOSE THE AGAINST THE WATER.
(on the intercom)
We've been hit! We're taking water!
Alarms sound! Red lights flash!
Flooding in the engine room!
Get me damage reports! Start the pumps!
(holding out a ship's phone)
It's the Captain -
On a phone, outside the ship's GYM, deep in the hull:
What the hell is going on?!?
(intercut if necessary)
I think we've been holed, sir!
On my way! He speeds along the passageway, going through a water-tig slamming it behind him. Meanwhile, on -
The engines are gone!
Flooding on D deck!
Sound the general alarm! Seal all compartments! As the Second Officer grabs the intercom - SECOND OFFICER (into intercom)
Attention all hands -
The crew members look up from their meals - SECOND OFFICER (continuing)
Proceed to emergency stations -

The men have closed the door, but... HEAR A HIGH-PITCHED GRINDING SOUND from the other side. They exchange a quizz they don't know what to make of it, when: BANG! The door explodes inward - and a high-pressured str water blasts in, blowing them back against the walls.
The lights go out! Everyone is scrambling:
We've lost power!
Go to back up generators! SECOND OFFICER (into intercom)
Repeat: Seal all compartments, and -
In the dim lighting - SECOND OFFICER (on intercom)

Proceed to emergency stations at once! The men start to move, but halt at A HUMMING SOUND. They around: Where is it coming from? Suddenly a THREE FOOT SECTION OF THE DECK EXPLODES IN A F WATER. The men are swept off their feet.
As the Captain rushes up the steps, he turns around, reac
BOOM! Water blasts through, like 1000 fire hydrants turne With terror in his eyes, THE CAPTAIN sprints up the rest stairs, through a water-tight door, into:
Where the Captain secures the door behind him, and rushes
A desperate battle continues:
Flooding on C-Deck!
Where the hell are those generators?
Coming up, sir!
Get those pumps working!
A CREWMAN hurriedly flips switches. The lights flicker... as they some to life, brightly - THE DOOR BURSTS OPEN, and a wall of water and debris blow destroying everything in its wake.
Lights out! A sense of helplessness is beginning to fill
The back-up is gone!
Flooding up to B-Deck!
We can't hold out much longer, sir! All eyes are on the First Officer. Will he save them?
Where the hell is the Captain?!?!

Running, the Captain is about to reach the exit door. Hea relentless grinding behind him, he throws a look over his BAM! The entrance door EXPLODES in a thunderball of water The Captain clambers through the exit door to:
A short hall: He shuts the entrance door, runs to the exi looks hack again: BAM! The door blasts open - and the torrent of water cont chase, as if it's got a personal vendetta against him. He

Slamming the door behind him, the Captain looks ahead, an STAIRS. AN OPEN DOOR AT THE TOP. He throws a look back: THE ENTRANCE DOOR IS BEGINNING TO HUM AND VIBRATE. Sprinting for his life, the Captain rushes up the stairs, time. The humming behind him grows louder. He glances bac THE DOOR BLASTS OPEN. WATER SHOOTS IN. He rushes up the last four steps, just as -
With PANIC IN HIS EYES, the Captain turns to face the onc tsunami! We cut to:
Moving like a shark... Toward THE CAPTAIN'S LEGS, DEAD AH WATER. As it closes in for the kill -
Shifts, suddenly, to the stern. A confusion of anxious vo
Slipping to stern!
All major compartments flooded! With all hands still awaiting orders - THE ROOM LURCHES AS THE BOW RISES! Papers fly! Men slide! First Officer has no choice:
Abandon ship! Break radio silence! Send our position!
The Communications Officer types: "Top Secret. Indian Oce Command. H.M.S. Indomitable Sinking."
(calling out)
What's our position?
(reading off his screen)
One hundred degrees, thirty-one minutes, and seven seconds East, by two degrees, twenty-nine minutes, ten seconds, North. As he types, the room lurches again, tilting more to the
As the passageway shifts, tilting to the stern, the Capta and WHOOSH! - is sucked down into the water - the worm's like meat being fed into a Cuisinart: A churning, spinnin
Bow rises completely out of the water as the stern goes u
TWO CREWMAN manage to get a LIFEBOAT away. TWO OTHERS scr from below and leap into the water.
The bow is at a forty-five degree angle... And the H.M.S. Indomitable pauses - for just a moment - before SLIPPING FIRST, throwing up a series of great waves.
Rocked by waves from the sinking ship. The Cook, a Marine Crewmen hear a splash along side. Two of the Crew pull th OFFICER aboard. He takes a minute to catch his breath, th
Six. That's it? Only six of us?
Most of the crew never made it to their life jackets. The Captain?
(shrugs, then:)
The First officer stayed on the bridge. One of the CREWMAN SPOTS SOMETHING IN THE DISTANCE:
Hey - look! Over there!
The SEA DOLPHIN II emerges from a cove, looking like a gh apparition in the fog.
The men yell and wave and whistle, hoping to be saved.
Elliot Harmsway removes a pair of binoculars from his fac YUNG, standing next to him at the rail:

Lovely night for a shipwreck, isn't it? Yung looks at Harmsway like he's crazy. Oblivious, Harmsw his WATCH, then looks through the BINOCULARS again - and WHISTLE the opening notes of My Fair Lady's "WOULDN'T IT ("All I want is a room somewhere, far away from the cold

As the men cry for help, the Sonar Operator spots somethi below the surface, moving toward the lifeboat at great sp He hears the hum. His eyes follow the churning water... And suddenly - out of nowhere - the Worm hits the lifeboa below, smashing it to bits, hurtling the pieces in the ai
Harmsway lowers the binoculars' smiling. Stamper appears, Harmsway a piece of paper.
We've decoded their last transmission. Harmsway studies it for a moment - smiles.
Perfect. They'll be searching miles from here. (then)
Time for phase two. You can get the men in the water. And with this, Harmsway turns, and walks off, jauntily wh "Wouldn't It Be Loverly." Stamper looks at Yung, re: Harmsway's glee.
You heard him. Get the men in the water!

head_text.subj: SIDE OF THE SEA DOLPHIN II

text: In the water next to the chip, FOUR DIVERS drop the last equipment in a DIVE BOAT. They cast off, motoring into th
The classic Michelin building on Fulham road.
A YOUNG WOMAN is yammering away at Bond; he's trying to p face on what is obviously a dreadful fix-up first date.
I can't believe it took us so long to finally get together! What exactly do you do for the government?
(after a beat)
You might say... 'Public relations.'
How fascinating! I bet you meet all the most fabulous people. Before Bond can answer, the MAITRE D' interrupts.
Excuse me - Mr. Bond? You have a call. Bond excuses himself.
007 picks up the receiver, without saying hello:
Moneypenny! You're early. You weren't supposed to call until - (he stiffens)
Yes. I understand. Twenty minutes.
Passing a NEWSPAPER DELIVERY TRUCK with an ad for "TOMORR Paper that Never Lies,") Bond's DB-5 roars past the guard
ADMIRAL ROEBUCK glares as MINISTER JOHNSTONE enters to ad TANNER, A TREASURY OFFICIAL, and various UNIFORMS and SUI
Good evening. I've just spoken with the Prime Minister at the economic summit in Tokyo; he's expecting a full update within the hour. (beat)
For those of you still unaware, some forty minutes ago -
(interrupting)
Excuse me, but - (all turn to him:)

I must formally protest this meeting. Given the nature of what's occurred - and the need for secrecy - I see no reason to involve the air force, the army, or MI-6. (beat, as M and Tanner exchange a look)
This is an internal affair that should be handled strictly by the officers of her Majesty's Royal Navy.
(furious)
Admiral, are you suggesting - He's distracted by the CLICK OF A DOOR OPENING. All turn entering, wearing a FULL NAVAL UNIFORM. M stifles a smile
Sorry I'm late -
Actually, you're just in time. (she turns to)
Admiral Roebuck: You know Commander Bond, don't you?
(deflated)
Yes. Of course.
I've looked forward to meeting you. Bond sits. M glances at Johnstone as if to say "proceed."
As I was saying: Approximately forty- five minutes ago, we received an abandon ship signal from the H.M.S. Indomitable. (flicks on a map display)
Looking at these infrared satellite images - provided by Mr. Tanner of MI-6 -the ship is presumed lost here, just south of Kuala Lumpur, where she broadcast her last position.
Foreground, empty diving boat. Background, Sea Dolphin II "flexible hose" hanging over the rail, down into the wate
Stamper works "worm" master control with a video joystick
Divers approaching the hull. Harmsway and Yung look over his shoulder at:

Through the worm's UNDERWATER camera, FOUR DIVERS with TO WELDING TOOLS are about to enter the HOLE in the Indomita (The video screen also contains lots of digital informati divers and the worm's functions.)
The worm follows the Divers into the hull.
It trails the Divers past debris and bodies of crewman.
(into microphone)
To the right, towards the stern. The Divers react, and the worm follows them into...
The Divers and worm travel to a HATCH COVERED WITH METAL Lighting the welding torches, they try to cut through the bars... Unsuccessfully.
One of the Divers turns to the worm's camera. He SPEAKS i diving helmet's microphone:
(through speaker)
It's titanium. we can't cut through.
Stamper turns to Harmsway:
I'll do it. HARMSWAY (into microphone)
Divers, stand aside.

The worm moves into position to grind through the hatch. cover slides over the lens, and the grinder whorls into l CLOSER ON THE WORM - The grinder stalls for an instant as encounters the titanium bars. STILL CLOSER - One of the URANIUM GRINDING TEETH SNAPS OF the titanium, and starts to grind through.

Once past the bars, the grinder cuts easily through the s Trapped air bursts out from inside the compartment. The D the worm to one side; two of them enter the hold with lig worm follows. The two other divers remain behind to feed flexible tubing through the door.
The Divers' lights illuminate the hold: STACKS OF GOLD BA as the eye can see.
Harmsway looks at the video screen.
Gentlemen: I do believe we've struck gold... Four minutes ahead of schedule.
The worm closes its "eye", revs up its grinders, and atta first pile of gold Bars. It runs through them like butter
The bloodletting and recriminations have begun. This play
(incredulous)
One-third of the British gold reserves?!? (beat)
What kind of idiot loses - (looks to the treasury officer)
What is it? The equivalent of ten billion US dollars???
(sheepishly)
Give or take. Depending on today's currency rates -
(ignoring him)
What the hell was the gold doing on that boat?
We were bringing it back from Hong Kong. Under orders from the Treasury.
During the cold war, we stored a third in America, and another third in Hong Kong - in case of a nuclear attack. And with the turn-over of Hong Kong to the Chinese -
Why wasn't the ship protected?!?! Why was it sailing without radar?
I resent your tone, sir. I have men who are missing -
And I have the entire British economy to worry about.
(breaking in)
Minister - (all turn to him)
Obviously, MI-6 was not involved in this operation. But I have to defend the Admiral. Roebuck looks at Bond with great surprise. Bond continues BOND (cont'd)
Electronic silence was the safest way to move that gold. Otherwise, any country - or individual - with the crudest missile could just lock onto our signals, and take out the boat. (beat)
That's what happened to the Sheffield in the Falklands. (beat)
Since then, it's standard operating procedure for any sensitive shipment.
(frowns)
At least we know where the gold is. When are the recovery ships due?
36 hours. They've already sailed from the Persian gulf.
I expect to have that gold recovered in 36 hours. Until then, I'm imposing my own electronic silence: For the sake of the economy, not a word to NATO, the press, the CIA. (beat, looking at:)
...And so long as Commander Bond here seems to be such an expert on these matters, I want him to go along as an observer. Are we agreed?
Yes.
Yes.
As you wish.

Harmsway walks along the side of the ship, observing the The WORM'S DREDGING PUMP sucks up the ground-up GOLD AND RY, (through the TUBE hanging over the side,) and dumps i SERIES OF SLUICES. At each stage the gold nuggets fall to of the sluice, and excess water flows off the side of the
where all the water has been drained off, leaving a casca nuggets pouring into the ship's hold - HARMSWAY reaches into the shimmering cascade, and takes a of gold. He sees Stamper approaching.
Remember the golden rule, Mr. Stamper: He who has the gold, rules. He drops the gold back in the hold.
Is the helicopter ready?
Fueled and waiting.
Good. We have an appointment in Hong Kong.
M and Bond, striding down a hallway to exit the building.
...You're turning into quite the politician, 007.
I have an excellent teacher. (sideways glance)
'Make sure you wear the uniform'?
(ignoring his jibe)
What do you make of all this?
It doesn't quite add up. They've come to a door. Pause as he opens it. He explains
The infrared satellite images. No heat, no flame, no explosion. If that boat went down where they said it did, there should have been some residual heat reading on the surface.
Sabotage?
A three-thousand ton frigate doesn't just vanish into thin air. She nods and pushes through the door. He follows.
I've already contacted our station in Kuala Lumpur. They're lining up a local contact. (beat)
I want you to find that gold, and secure it. They've arrived at her car. The door is already open.
... Didn't Elliot Harmsway just move his headquarters to Kuala Lumpur? She turns, freezes Bond with a look:

Contrary to what you may believe, 007, the world is not filled with mad-men who can hollow out volcanoes, stock them with big-breasted women, and threaten the world with nuclear annihilation. Bond reacts to the comeuppance. She continues: M (cont'd)
The case is closed. The Italian authorities ruled the girl a suicide. We had enough trouble keeping your name out of the media. For everyone's sake - (beat)
Your job is to find the gold. Not settle some personal score with Elliot Harmsway.
Super: HONG KONG. Harmsway's helicopter is perched atop t tinker-toy-styled building in the Central district.
A CHINESE CHOP comes down firmly on a legal document. GEN the People's Revolutionary Army) is seated with a squad o

And that is the fifth document. With your counter-signature, the sale will be complete. The document is passed across to HARMSWAY, sitting with h counsel. One of the men is WHISPERING TO HIM, INTENSELY:
Are you sure? If we waited - Harmsway waves the lawyer off, silencing him. Addresses t
General Li: My young associate here has just informed me that if I waited a year, I could perhaps receive a higher price for this building. (beat, wryly)
He has great faith in Hong Kong. As did my ancestors. With obvious results. Nervous chuckles around the table, but the General is res HARMSWAY (cont'd)

Yet to sell this building for more money - to profiteer - would run counter to the Chinese sprit of guanchi - mutual trust and obligation; it would violate the ancient principles of feng shui - (beat)
- the reason we sign five documents instead of an unlucky four, and why this building has a fifth, non-functioning ventilation shaft on its roof. (beat)
Wind and water, fire and rain, earth and sky - feng shui. All things - at one, in balance, with nature.
...Most eloquently put, Sir Elliot.
Thank you, General Li. Now I'll just sign this last document - He puts the pen to the paper, and BREAKS THE PEN. Alarmed HARMSWAY (cont'd)
Terribly sorry. Mr. Stamper? From behind, Stamper hands him a pen. Harmsway innocently sign in RED INK -
Sir Elliot! Red ink -
Of course! How foolish. More bad luck. I'll just borrow yours - He takes General Li's pen, and signs his name with a flou
Under the whirring blades of the chopper, Harmsway bids f General Li. He and Stamper get in helicopter.
As Harmsway waves good-bye from the window, the helicopte REVEALING a METAL CABLE attached to the LANDING SKID.
The cable leads to a spool, which runs to the FIFTH METAL SHAFT Harmsway referred to in the last scene.
Harmsway pops open a bottle of champagne.
An old Chinese toast to our friends...
The General SEES THE CABLE GROW TAUT AROUND THE VENTILATI He reacts with horror.
Harmsway glances down to watch the VENTILATION SHAFT TOPP General and his aides, scattering them like rats. In the chopper, the pilot cuts the cable, and Harmsway li champagne glass:
Confusion to the enemy. In 48 hours, that building - and all of Hong Kong around it - will cease to exist.
