A BRITISH MILITARY C-130 airship is dropping sono-buoys i water from a low altitude. me plane veers off, revealing SEA KING command and control helicopter, hovering above.
Bond holds a map of the channel. He's standing over sever seated at radar, sonar, and navigation consoles.
Sounding: Bottom is thirty fathoms.
Nothing. Negative bounce.
We should be right over it. They hear a SHARP DINGING SOUND -
Wait - I'm getting something.
Where? What is it? The man points at one of the screens, where Bond sees a C GENERATED MAP OF THE SEA FLOOR, with the FAINT OUTLINE of
Not sure yet - He types in some commands on a keyboard, and a 3-D render boat appears on another computer screen. Lots of data:
The Shinjuku. Japanese troop carrier. World War II.
Let's make another pass.
(calling out)
We have traffic on the deck - They look down and see an HNN (Harmsway News Network) boa
Get rid of them.
The chopper hovers above the HNN boat - PILOT (on pa speaker)
Please leave the area. please leave the area.

We're looking up at the world's tallest building: The 150 Petronas Towers. (They look like an architectural collabo between Friz Lang and H.G. Wells.) At the 50th floor, the bridge connecting the buildings, where -
Elliot Harmsway strides out of an elevator (in Tower 1,) of waiting assistants. Without breaking stride -
Good morning Sir Elliot! Welcome to Kuala Lumpur -
Morning, morning all. What have we got? His EXECUTIVE SECRETARY rushes to keep up, reading from a they cross the sky bridge to HNN's main reception area, i
The Canadian Prime Minister wants to set a lunch -
Pencil it in for the next trip -
The American presidential candidate called to complain about that sex story -
Send him a $10,000 campaign contribution, and explain I have no control over what my journalists write -
Your bankers want an answer about the Brazilian TV stations
No -
The Queen invited you to dinner -
Yes -
And the 9:30 news meeting is waiting.
Excellent. They've passed from the bridge, through reception, into:
A glass conference roam, whose PARTIALLY CLOSED BLINDS ob view of the MAMMOTH HNN NEWS CENTER. (We'll see this, in later.) Meanwhile, a DOZEN RAMBUNCTIOUS EDITORS react to:
Morning, all my golden retrievers. What kind of havoc shall we create in the world today?
- A ferry sank and burned in Pakistan; 457 dead.
Good.
American jetliner down in Omaha -
Better.
Economic summit ends in Tokyo -
Boring -
Riots broke out at the World Cup soccer finals -
Dog bites man. (explains)
Man bites dog is a news story. Riots at the World Cup soccer finals is a social announcement. Next?

This just came in: There's something up with the British Navy in the Strait. Rescue planes, helicopters; two ships supposedly sailing from the Persian gulf. They just chased away one of our news boats.
(feigning complete innocence)
Is that so?
Yeah. Sounds like a plane went down or something... Either way, they're calling it - all together now:
"A routine training exercise."
I'm shocked!! Issue the usual vehement protest: Freedom of the press, people's right to know... Lather it up with a lot of righteous indignation. (off their laughter)
Next?
Frowning, Bond peers at the Sonar Operator's screen.
Still nothing? The operator shakes his head. The pilot calls back from t
Commander Bond: They've found one of the crewman's bodies!
The Sea King comes in above several police cars and boats jumps the last ten feet, and the chopper peels off.
Yo! Jimbo! Bond turns to look: It's JACK WADE.
Wade, what the hell are you doing here?
I am not here, ol' buddy. The CIA has absolutely no knowledge of the missing ship, the missing gold, where it was going, or when it left Hong Kong.
That's reassuring.
Hey - the world is my office.
Let's take a look at the body. As Bond moves off, WADE SNIFFS THE AIR, savoring the arom
Smells like... Coffee plants.
A POLICEMEN pulls a white sheet from the body. (We don't Bond and Wade look down at something gruesome:
Colorful... Shark attack? Bond shakes his head grimly.
I don't think so. The veins are cauterized - as if they were sealed by heat... (beat, confounded)
But there are no burn marks on the flesh. It doesn't make sense. (to the policeman)
Who found the body?
(points to)
Dato. Local fisherman. Says it came in with the tide early this morning.
Ask him if it could have washed in from the west side of the Strait. The POLICEMAN has an animated conversation with FISHERMAN
No. He says it's not possible. The current could have only brought the body in from the east.
(to Wade)
You have a boat?
I don't know if you'd call it a boat...
Something with an engine? Not oars?
Step into my office.
Smashing through the water at breakneck speed. Wade and B over the engines.
What do you want with the Harbor Master?
Tide and current charts. Work backward from the body - find where the ship sank. (Wade nods appreciatively)
Where did you get the boat?
Seized it from a guy smuggling computer chips out of Bangkok. (beat)
Should have seen his rose garden: Blooms the size of hand grenades. Bond looks at Wade: The man remains, forever deranged.
The Harbor Master's tower overlooks a small armada of yac boats, etc. A series of long dockways jut out into the ha
Wade's boat is moving slowly along the waterway at the en docks. Looking off, Bond spots the Harbor Master's Tower:
Over there. Wade turns the boat down one of the dock channels.

A SLEEK LAUNCH is ROARING TOWARDS them, on a dead collisi A WOMAN in a baseball cap is at the wheel. WADE pulls his boat to the right; the LAUNCH ROARS AROUND rocking the cigarette boat with its wake. BOTH BOND and WADE clock the woman - who we will later le SIDNEY WINCH. Wade stares after her:
I think I've just seen my next future ex-wife.
(seeing they're about to crash)
Not if you kill us first - unless that's how you plan to leave Muffy. Wade scowls, setting the boat back on course.
Bond hops off the boat, securing the lines. Wade joins hi
By the way, Jimbo - whatever happened to that girl - in Cuba - ? Finished tying the boat, they walk toward the Harbor Mast
Natalya?
Yeah. Russian Minister of Transportation.
She married a hockey player.
I envy your 'undercover' assignments.
(a look, then)
We work in the dark. We do what we can.
The local Malay harbor master puts a stack of charts on t
Wind, tide, currents... You're the second person today asked for a full set of charts. (holds out a clipboard)
If you'd just sign here - Bond takes the clipboard - INSERT CLIPBOARD - read signature: SIDNEY WINCH. Bond returns the clipboard:
Thanks. (apparent afterthought)
By the way - was there anything strange the night before last? Odd weather, lost boats - ??
No... Unless you're talking about the bus problem.
...Bus problem?

Captain Cheong's ferry was late. He runs the line across the Strait between here and Sumatra. The lumber mill workers coming back for the weekend missed the last bus. Slept on the docks. Hundreds of them.
Thanks.
Bond emerges, carrying the charts, along with Wade.
I have to get these to London. Do you know this Captain Cheong?
Spends his nights at the Kuala Lumpur yacht club.
Can you arrange a meeting?
Hell. The CIA built that club.
Palm trees, torch lights, and Rolls Royces.
A local band plays on the verandah. We find Wade at a POK with five local Malay Chinese. He CUTS THE CARDS, exubera

Okay gentlemen. The name of the game is 7-card Cambodian stud. Everything is wild! And then - moving through a beaded glass curtain - we fin white dinner jacket, sitting with CAPTAIN CHEONG. The Cap elegant, mid-5O's, eye patch. (To be put into local diale
In the Strait of Malacca, when a boat is even five minutes late, one begins to worry, Mr. Bond.
I know. Pirates from Sumatra want the cargo; smugglers from Thailand and Burma want the ships.
Sometimes kill the crew; other times - (points to his eye)
Torture them.
I'm sorry.
The Kuala Lumpur ferry was 35 miles off-course that night. Captain blamed the auto-pilot; I suspected he was drunk - until the Sumatra ferry captain had same problem.
Did you test the auto-pilots? The satellite positioning receiver?
Next morning. Both boats. Nothing wrong. (chuckles)
My 90 year old grandfather thinks 'Ghost in the computer - Silicon Dragon.'
(smiles, standing to leave)
I appreciate your time -
Maybe you should talk to Sidney Winch. Owns a marine salvage company. Nobody knows more about the Strait.
Where can I find him?
Him? He, is a she - (points)
at the bar.
SIDNEY WINCH, about 32, tough, smart, and (here's a surpr beautiful, is ordering a drink when Bond appears:
Bourbon. Neat.

I wonder if you handle your liquor more carefully than you handle your boat. Very slowly, Sidney turns to Bond. She looks him up and d deciding whether this specimen is worth her time. Her con definite - though skeptical - maybe. She gives him a sult
Sometimes, you just have to plunge into things. Be reckless.
- And I bet you always leave turmoil in your wake.
(thinking, 'not bad')
Have we met?
This afternoon. Our boats practically kissed in the harbor. (holds out his hand to shake)
James Bond.
Sidney Winch. The BARTENDER APPEARS.
Vodka martini, shaken not stirred. (to Sidney)
And another for you?
No. But you can buy a drink for my friend, Taro. She steps back REVEALING a huge SAMOAN, TARO, wearing a d tie, sitting on a stool. Taro smiles menacingly at Bond.
Boyfriend?
Chaperone. I'm waiting for my dinner date.
Pity. (to Bartender)
Bring him whatever he wants.
So what brings you to Kuala Lumpur, Mr. Bond? (beat)

Wait - don't tell me: Unhappy marriage? Running from some poor little girl with two kids and a Chanel pocketbook in - London? Bond analyzes the situation: 1) She's with a thug. 2) She salvage. 3) She went to the Harbor Master's office for th 4) She's a smart-ass. He decides to see if he can rattle
Actually, I'm here on business. You might say it was a... Golden opportunity.
(a chill in her voice)
And exactly what business are you in, Mr. Bond?
Insurance. Lloyds of London.
(daggers in her voice)
The Strait can be a very dangerous place, Mr. Bond. A few words scribbled on a piece of paper in London doesn't carry a lot of value out here. Including life insurance.
I'll keep that in mind.
(looking off)
I see my date is here. (to Taro)
And I think Mr. Bond is ready to leave.
Nice to run into you again.
Let's not make it a habit. She exits. Turning his back on Taro, Bond watches her cro room. Taro places a huge hand on Bond's shoulder -
I think you should go -
Not quite yet, Taro - And from BOND'S POV - Sidney greets HARMSWAY with a big h
Uncle Elliot!! Watching this, Bond seethes with memory of Paris and his Harmsway. Taro tightens his grip -

I said you should - But before he finishes, Bond spins, and: 1) slams Taro's bar, 2) snatches the ice-pick from the bartender, 3) yank ward by his collar, 4) slams the ice-pick through Taro's wooden bar, and 5) kicks the stool out from under the goo Taro is now hanging by his tie, from the bar, choking. Bond takes a moment to straighten his own bow-tie. Wade a jubilant, with a wad of cash:
Yo! Jimbo! I won five hundred - (seeing Taro)
What happened?
He tied one on.
Bond walks down a long dock towards a lone boat, moored a

Bond looks around furtively, before climbing aboard the s going craft. On the aft-deck, there's a large covered obj As Bond reaches for the CABIN DOOR, it opens by itself - succession of THREE YOUNG ENGLISH WOMEN in STRING BIKINIS
Good morning!
Good morning.
(calling back into the cabin)
He's arrived. Bond turns from the door to watch the women. He hears:
You're late 007. I've been expecting you. Q emerges from the cabin in a blazer and an ascot. He's i
Q! How are you?
Retired. I'm not getting paid to help you save the world anymore.
I'm sorry. It was a national emergency -
That hardly makes up for the imposition. (beat)
Now, for what I hope will be the very last time - pay attention, 007. (he unfurls a map:)
First, computer generated retrograde analysis map. Body here, meteorolog- ical influences here, likely vector- ing of the ship's coordinates here.
Do you have any idea of what any of that means? In English?
Not a clue. I didn't lose the ship. (reaches for a Filofax sized device)
Next, your new personal communicator. (flips it open)
Picture-phone, fax, beeper.
(taking it)
Do I have to dial '9' to get out?
I don't care who you dial, so long as it's not me. Next - Q walks to the large object on the aft-deck. Pulls off a
Your new car. (Insert name)
(interrupting)
- Four wheel drive?
Yes. And do try to keep all four of them on the road. (continuing)
All the usual refinements: Smoke, missiles, machine guns - (shows him a key fob)
Fully operational remote control. Drives forward, reverse - (Bond presses a button, opening a window)
Stop that! (grabbing it away)
Plus infrared thermal imaging radar, heads up instrumentation, and 17 beverage cup holders.
... 17 Beverage cup holders?

Standard equipment. The world's automobile manufacturers seem to be in some kind of mad war to see who can provide the most beverage cup holders. Bond nods, and LOOKS AT a distraction from the GIRLS IN B
I must say, Q, you seem to be doing rather well in your retirement.
Don't even think about it. 007. They're my granddaughters.
Clear skies and blue water. The only vessel in sight is a five foot SPORT FISHING BOAT underway at full throttle.
Wade at the helm; Bond next to him, near sonar, holding Q
Slow down. We're close. Wade pulls back on the throttle.
The boat starts a wide turn -
And we're back at the outcropping where the Indomitable s SPORT FISHING BOAT is trolling against a background of sa and the lush green hills of Sumatra.
Wade scans the shore; Bond studies the sonar display.
I dunno, Jimbo. It can't be out here. How could they get this far off course?
(concentrating on the sonar)
Who knows? Fog, night...
They'd never sail this close to the shore.
Wait a minute - (beat, pointing to the screen)
I've got it. There! Off the port bow!
The murky electronic outline of a ship.
Bond watches the sonar screen. Wade slows engines, consul
Cut the engines! It's about two- hundred fifty feet down.

head_text.subj: AN ANCHOR BEING PITCHED INTO THE WATER

text: By Wade. Bond is strapping on his scuba tank.
Two-fifty's pretty deep for air. You should really be using mixed gases. Bond glances at the air gauge on his tanks.
I'll make a bounce dive. If I can keep my bottom time short, I'll be all right. Bond gathers up FLARES, and sits on the gunwale.
(only half teasing)
Keep your eye out for pirates. Wade pulls back his shirt to reveal TWO SIX-SHOOTERS.
I got you covered.
That's reassuring. Bond rolls backward into the water and disappears.
Bond swims to the anchor line, and begins pulling himself handover-hand, deeper and deeper into a monochromatic glo
Bond touches down by the anchor; his fins kick up the san Checking his wrist compass, he sets off through a rocky c

Ahead, in the dimness, a huge gray shape looms out of the Bond lights a FLARE, and the scene is suddenly alive with From Bond's position, the hull seems to go on forever bef lost beyond range of his flare. Bond checks his air gauge
Depth: 283 feet - Air capacity: 3/4 tank remaining.
Bond swims to the hole in the side of the Indomitable. He study the damage. Then enters.
Bond sees the damage on the passageway door. Swims throug
The flare throws eerie shadows along the corridor; Bond s busted bilge-hold hatch. Again, he pauses to examine the by the worm. He drops into the hold.
The gold is gone. Bond swims a few yards in: Nothing. A v space. Bond's flare sputters and dies. He drops it, light As he turns to exit, SOMETHING GLINTS on the deck below t He moves toward it.

A half-chewed GOLD BAR is wedged between a brace and the Bond reaches for it, feeling the worm's drill marks on th Just as he yanks the bar out, a MORAY EEL lashes out from brace, baring its teeth. Still clutching the gold bar, Bond jumps back, and shoots
where he collides with something floating just below the Dropping the flare on the impact, Bond twists around to s THE FACE OF A FLOATING DEAD SAILOR.
Throwing wildly gyrating shadows, the flare drops to the ing under some debris. Regaining his composure, Bond SLIP BAR INTO A WEBBED SACK ON HIS BELT, then moves to retriev
Bond reaches for the flare, under a section of the torn h He notices the BROKEN URANIUM GRINDING TOOTH. He picks it it into his sack, and swims off.
Bond swims to the anchor line, grabs hold, and starts up. way, he glances at his gauges:
Depth: 160 feet - Air capacity: below RED LINE - empty. T light level on the gauges suddenly DARKENS.

head_text.subj: BOND LOOKS UP TO THE SURFACE -

text: A black HULL has blotted out the light... And SOMETHING L HEAVY IS FALLING straight at 007.

kicks away from the anchor-line just as a 1000 POUND ANCH by. He looks up again: THREE DIVERS ARE IN THE WATER. One carries a strange-looking HARPOON-TYPE GUN; another t CABLE. The divers have fanned out, looking for 007.

Realizes his best chance is to take one of the men hostag Flashing his KNIFE, Bond cuts the cord to his gold/uraniu STUFFS THE SACK INTO HIS BAGGY SWIM TRUNKS. Bond rockets up, SLAMMING INTO DIVER #1. A confusion of b And just as Bond overcomes the man - spinning him around, knife to the diver's throat - DIVER #2 SHOOTS the HARPOON-TYPE GUN, and A DOLPHIN NET e ENVELOPING BOND AND THE DIVER in a mesh. (Note: This is a 'fish friendly' research tool.) Diver #3 HOOKS THE CABLE he's been trailing onto the net,

The net erupts through the surface, is hauled up into the deposited on - THE DECK OF A SELF-PROPELLED SALVAGE BARGE. (An old scow, with a large crane, two-story deck-house, a whose idea of 'cruise-wear' runs to tattoos and grotesque

As the water drains from his mask, Bond sees the mesh bei away, and FIVE GOONS come into focus, training AUTOMATIC him. (Bond still has the diver from behind, knife to his One of the goons reaches forward, ripping off Bond's mask
Brandishing an UZI at Bond, with a malevolent smile:
Uzi beats knife.
...Interesting point. Bond sticks the knife into the deck, and releases the hos
Get him up. Take his belt. (motioning to Wade)
Take the two of them to the Captain. The men grab Bond roughly, and shove him next to Wade.
By the way. I almost forgot. (smashing Bond)
I owed you one. Bond and Wade are frog-marched to the bridge, passing und of various cutthroat crew members. Wade is completely unf
(sniffs the air)
Smell that Jimmy? Sea Kelp. Bond gives Wade a look.
Hey - it could be worse. At least they speak English. Bond glances up at a crew member, SHARPENING A MACHETE, s
...Somehow, that's not reassuring.
We're back in Bond-land: A high-tech control room, with l monitors and white-suited TECHNICIANS. Bond and Wade are through the-door, followed by Taro and the two goons.
Here they are, Captain. The "Captain" turns from a monitor: IT'S SIDNEY.
Just give me one goad reason - Mister Bond, from Lloyds of London - why I shouldn't kill both of you, burn your boat, and use your bodies for shark bait.
(chirping up)
So you two know each other!?! Small world, ain't it? What happened? Commitment problems?
Who is he?
Sidney Winch, meet -
Jack Wade. Citibank. Commercial loan division. If you're ever lookin' for a sweet refinance on the boat -
- Shut up!
(to Wade)
You have to excuse Miss Winch: She thinks she's on a 'seduce and destroy' mission through life... (pauses)
...But she won't kill us.
No?
No. First, because I don't think it's in your nature. And second, because there's no gold down there.
So charming! So suave! (beat)
Don't insult me. I'm not one of your 'little London girls' who falls for the lies.
So it was commitment!
Every wharf-rat from here to Hong Kong knows what's on that boat and I'm claiming it. One-third of that gold is mine.
That's fine, but - even a little London girl knows that one third of nothing is still nothing. There's a flicker of doubt in her eyes. She turns to Taro
Was he carrying anything? Taro holds up the BOND'S DIVING BELT, indicating 'nothing
Search him. The men look at Bond - wearing only swim trunks. Nobody m
Do I have to do everything around here?
I hope so. Frowning, Sidney moves to Bond. As she REACHES INTO HIS T cut to THEIR FACES. THEIR EYES ARE LOCKED ON EACH OTHER:
I hope you'll be gentle.
Think about mom. BOND WINCES. She's goosed him.
... Unusual technique. Returning to the WIDE SHOT, she opens the sack. SHOWS THE
And what do you call this?
- The family jewels? She scowls, takes out the URANIUM TOOTH. Looks at it, bla holds it out to a TECHNICIAN, who examines it.
What is this?
...I don't know. I'm not sure - Just then, a CREWMAN BURSTS IN:
Boss! We got company - comin' up off the starboard bow!
(exiting, to Taro)
Bring them. Taro motions with his Uzi for Bond and Wade to follow... But BOND hesitates, LOOKING BACK AT THE TECHNICIAN with t 007 wants to get it, but Taro nudges him out with the gun
A BRITISH NAVAL CUTTER is pulling alongside the barge - S WAILING, crew members in battle gear, FORWARD GATLING GUN
(on bullhorn)
Attention sea barge: Lay down your weapons, and prepare to be boarded. ON THE BARGE - Sidney and Co. stand, weapons ready.
Repeat: Lay down your weapons, and prepare to be boarded. Bond turns to Sidney, who's grabbed a bullhorn of her own
If I were you -
- You're not.
(as she hoists the bullhorn)
Just remember: They think there's ten billion dollars in gold down there.
Thank you. (clicks it on, and:)
"Now hear this: Drop dead." Bond and Wade exchange an amused/helpless glance - as if know what's coming next. There's a pause, then -

head_text.subj: THE CRUISER'S GATLING GUN ERUPTS WITH AN EARDRUM-SHATTERI

text: It's only a warning shot, but - EVERYONE ON THE BARGE DIVES FOR THE DECK... Except for Bo Wade, who might as well be having tea. Bond looks down at cowering on the boards.
Gatling gun beats Uzi.
An ARMED BOARDING PARTY is coming across an aluminum brid extended from the Cutter onto the barge.
(a tiny popinjay)
Who's in charge here?
I am. What do you want?
You have precisely one minute to pull up your anchor and be under way.
Forget it. No way. I got here first.
(ignoring her)
Who's Wade?
That would be me -
(snidely)
Thanks for your message. (turns to)
And you're Bond?
Yes -
Guard! Arrest these men! Escort them to the cutter! Bond and Wade are stunned. The Marines move in. Bond stru
Wait a minute -
Get them out of here. If he says one word, shoot him. As TWO MARINES with automatic rifles take Bond and Wade a folding bridge -
(demanding)
What's your name?
Captain Morton. Pause. She expects him to ask "And yours?" but he doesn't
My name is Sidney Winch, and -
Good for you, Miss Winch. You now have exactly 30 seconds to get this rust bucket out of here.
(furiously)
I know my rights. These are international waters. The British Navy abandoned that boat, and I'm claiming it. Under international law, I have the right to salvage what's on that wreck.
Fifteen seconds. Perhaps you should consider hiring an attorney.
I was an attorney!
Hmmm. I suppose this is a step above that profession. (beat)
Ten seconds. Are you leaving?
No.
You leave me no alternative.
(upholstering a walkie-talkie)
Cut her anchor. As Sidney yells "NO!" - THE FORWARD GATLING GUN erupts to short, bone rattling burst CUTS THE CHAIN.
You won't get away with this!
(stepping onto the bridge)
Good-day, Miss Winch. I advise you to get some steam up - before you run aground. As she floats away, Sidney calls out to the Captain, Bond
You bastards! Believe me - you haven't heard the last of me!
Bond, Wade and the Captain.
- Nice trick with the arrest. Very convincing.
It's no trick, Mr. Wade. I've got half a mind to throw both of you in the brig.
Don't you think you're overreacting?
(with great sarcasm)
Yes. The famous James Bond. I've heard all about you, sir. You were under direct orders to act as an observer - and yet you had to go off, on your own, like some half-assed CIA cowboy - (Wade reacts)
Endangering the gold, attracting that lunatic woman, and then putting in a distress call for us to save your bloody hide.
(Calmly)
...That's all well and good, Captain, save for one thing: (beat)
There's no gold down there.
What are you talking about? We went through all this and the ship isn't even down there?
Yes, the ship is down there. But the gold is gone.
That's absurd! It took two squads of forty men fifteen days to load that gold.
I know what I saw -
I don't care what you think you saw. You're a damned amateur. (beat)
Just get off my ship. Go back to your trench-coats and your code names - and leave the job to professionals.
(exchanges a glance with Wade, then)
Aye-aye, Captain.
As Bond and Wade push away from the Naval Cutter:
Where to now, Jimbo?
(thinking)
I'm not certain... But I think there's someone I want to press for some answers in Kuala Lumpur.
Bond'- car travels through the tropical landscape, turnin for Kuala Lumpur.
As Bond downshifts in anticipation of an upcoming hill, h RINGS. Before answering it, he looks down at:
Displayed on separate lines:, "INCOMING CALL." "ORIGIN: ( runs through numbers until it hits on) 763-4733." "NAME: UNKNOWN. "STATUS: (blinking) SECURE."
Reacting - the information is curious. Bond picks up the
Bond.
Hello, Mister Bond.
(with an edge)
Who is this?
Harmsway is perched on a desk. In the background, THROUGH OFFICE DOOR, we can see Harmsway's EXECUTIVE SECRETARY se someone coffee from a SILVER TRAY - but we can't see who
Elliot Harmsway! I heard you were in K.L. and thought we might get together for a chat...
HARMSWAY (Cont'd, O.S.)
We seemed to get off on the wrong foot back there in Venice.
How did you get this number?
Oh, please, Mr. Bond. We live in the information age! Information is currency - and with the right currency, you can have any piece of information. (Bond reacts, sourly)
Besides I own the phone company. What do you say? Twenty minutes?
I'm on my way. Bond hangs up, and drives with renewed determination.
Harmsway hangs up; STAMPER is standing nearby. Harmsway t concerned glance at his office, then turns to Stamper:
Let's find out exactly what he knows.
Bond's car approaches the camera, passes it, and heads fo TOWERS, looming over Kuala Lumpur in the distance.
Bond's car passes the front of the building, and drives d into an underground car park.

Passing NEWSPAPER LOADING DOCKS (with trucks displaying b "TOMORROW" and "HNN" logos, and HUM-VEES used by building Bond pulls into the VALET AREA - Where a cheerful YOUNG PR WOMAN and VALET wait. Both wear colorful BLAZER used by all Harmsway Building service per
(from inside the car)
James Bond to see Elliot Harmsway.
Yes. I'm to bring you right up. The valet will take your car -
I'd prefer to park it myself. (off her questioning look)
Temperamental. Practically has a mind of its own.
Don't they all? She points to a spot near the loading docks. Bond drives
Bond backs into the space, thinking about the (inevitable away. He looks through the windshield, surveying the area
TWO BURLY SECURITY GUARDS (in Harmsway Blazers,) stand be bulletproof security desk. There's a METAL DETECTOR by th
Reaching inside his jacket, Bond REMOVES HIS GUN, and HID compartment under the dashboard.
The PR WOMAN joins Bond as he locks the car with the REMO
Right this way. Following her through the metal detector, Bond scans the devices at the guard's desk: Lots of cameras, sensors, an
Bond and the PR Woman step off an escalator onto an open GLASS WINDOWS looking down into a mammoth NEWSPAPER PRINT
(moving to a door)
Mr. Harmsway is checking the afternoon editions. If you'll just follow me -

The NOISE FROM THE PRINTING PRESSES is deafening. Bond an WOMAN walk down a METAL STAIRCASE to the pressroom floor, Harmsway (wearing a printer's smock and newsprint cap,) i with SEVERAL PRESSMEN - a fresh issue of "Tomorrow" outst his hands.
(spotting Bond, yelling:)
Mr. Bond! Nice to see you.
Sir Elliot.
Come. Let's get out of the noise. (escorting Bond off)
- I'll give you a tour of the building, then we'll talk.
Harmsway is hanging up his smock in the short hallway tha the press room to an elevator. There's a SINK in the room
It's funny, Mr. Bond. Of all the things I own, nothing gives me as much enjoyment as my newspapers. He moves to the sink to wash his hands. Turns on the fauc HARMSWAY (cont'd)
Ironic, isn't it? In the age of TV, I still can't get the ink out of my veins. Bond SMILES WRYLY, looking at Harmsway hunched over the s
Yes... A man with ink in his veins, and blood on his hands. Harmsway smiles to himself, acknowledging the jibe... But ignore it. He turns off the faucet, dries his hands -
We print 31 newspapers here; another two-hundred-and-seventy at satellite plants around the world. He pulls on his 2000 Saville Row suit-jacket.
... And how many of those newspapers carried Paris Harmsway's obituary? Harmsway turns, and presses the ELEVATOR BUTTON. The door instantly. HE SMILES:
All of them, Mister Bond... (motioning inside)
After you?
The doors close. Bond clocks the security camera in the c Harmsway is about to take great delight in making Bond sq
Before I became involved with Paris, she was always involved with the most inappropriate' men... (beat)
Playboys. Thrill seekers. Middle aged Peter Pans who only brought out the worst in her.
I see.
I tried to save her. But she remained a manic depressive: Fits, inappropriate behavior... Delusions of grandeur.
I wonder if it runs in the family.
(bursts out in a laugh)
The only difference between a psychopath and a genius, Mr. Bond, is the degree of success. He looks up at the digital readout, going from 40 to 50.
Still, I do miss her. I only wish she could have lived to see all this.
I can feel your pain. The doors open:
By the way - what is it that brings you to Kuala Lumpur, Mister Bond?
Sightseeing. Harmsway motions for Bond to exit. They step out into:
A short hallway lined with OIL PORTRAITS of Harmsway's an Double doors at both ends. (People passing through.) As t
I call this the Rogue's gallery.
Yes. I can see: You've hung the rest of your relatives.
(pointing to the first portrait)
My third great Uncle - the Earl of Aberdeen - negotiated the purchase of Hong Kong from the Chinese. (moving to)
His son-in-law - George Harmsway - made the first family fortune, running opium into Shanghai... (moving to)
His son, Thomas, who lost it, smoking the opium... And my grandfather Henry, who opened the first telegraph station, and published the colony's first English newspaper. (pausing, wistfully)
It was a city of unlimited possibility.
So why did you leave?
Because it's a dying city. Since the Chinese take-over, who knows what can happen tomorrow? (moving to the last two portraits)
In any case, this is my father, Charles: A royal bastard who started the first radio and television stations. Said I'd never amount to anything, but... (passing his own portrait)
I turned it into this He pushes through a door, into:

A cavernous THREE STORY ROOM bristling with activity. At is the main HNN ANCHOR DESK, (where a news broadcast is i surrounded by scores of reporter's desks a la CNN. Around the perimeter of the room are VARIOUS TV STUDIOS l on Kuala Lumpur. All are broadcasting: A Larry King-type MTV; SPORTS; a KITCHEN where a chef is preparing somethin With its walls of monitors, equipment, and control rooms, is overwhelming. Harmsway will walk Bond around the perim
Welcome to the new world order, Mr. Bond. (starting to walk)
Churchill had his armies; Caesar had his legions; I have my divisions: (pointing)
News, sports, business, entertainment. And these are my foot soldiers: (a wave of his hand)
2000 people working on 14 floors to feed 300 newspapers, 4 cable news networks, 87 magazines, and 29 different cable TV channels - in 35 languages.
And still not a thing to watch. He glances at the SATELLITE CONTROL ROOM, with a NASA-typ
...Although it must be fun to have all those satellites.
They're merely tools to disseminate information.
(wryly)
Or disinformation... If you wanted to, say, beam down a signal to send a ship off course? Maybe one degree a minute?
(guffaws)
Fantastic idea Mr. Bond! Perhaps I should buy it for a book! It's totally preposterous, but - (off Bond's reaction)
You amuse me. ...And now perhaps I can amuse you. He stops at a VIDEO TERMINAL. Begins to type.
Let's see... First we have this James Bond... I believe he's a field adjuster for Lloyd's of London...
Then we have this James Bond.
(reading from the screen)
... Licensed to Kill... (aside)
Not a bad title for that book... (then)
Or perhaps you'd prefer this James Bond -
Who I believe they call "007." Bond is not amused. Harmsway is enjoying himself:

You see, Mr. Bond, you and I are both men of action. But your era is passing. Words are the new weapons; satellites the new artillery. And make no mistake about it: In the right hands, they can be as deadly as your Walther PPK.
...Words to live by?
Your choice. (glancing at his watch)

Look at the time! Come. There's someone I want you meet - about a story I'm thinking of publishing. As they leave, Bond is frustrated by Harmsway's "I don't you think you know - I can crush you" attitude... And now plans (and the operative word here is plans,) to use Bond the one other loose thread in his perfect crime:
The DOOR opens and Harmsway enters, followed by Bond. He someone we don't see:
Hello, dear. I'm sorry I took so long - REVEAL: SIDNEY is sitting across from his desk.
That's okay, Uncle Ell - She freezes in mid-sentence, seeing Bond. Bond is equally
What is HE doing here?
I see you two have met.
Briefly.
(crossing to his desk)
Don't pout, Sidney. I invited him here hoping he might shed some light on your story. He's from 'Lloyd's of London.' (sly glance to Bond)
...Aren't you, Mr. Bond?
He's not going to tell the truth! He was diving for the gold! Harmsway sits, and addresses Bond, matter-of-factly:

It seems - Mr. Bond - that Miss Winch has told me the most incredible story: A sunken British warship filled with gold; a British cutter firing on her; billions of dollars in bullion lying on the bottom of the Strait. Bond isn't enjoying this charade.
Obviously, the British government denies all of this -
- I told you! He was there! -
- But as I've explained to Sidney, without proof, there's just no story. Don't you agree Mr. Bond? Before Bond can answer -

But I have proof! You ran out of here so fast, I didn't get to show you. Bond and Harmsway react - with entirely different concern wasn't expecting her to have proof; Bond knows that if sh the gold, (or worse, the uranium tooth,) Harmsway will pr both of them to destroy the evidence, and witnesses.
(forcing a smile)
...And what's that, my dear?
Sidney, perhaps we should leave this to - Sidney cuts Bond off, DROPPING THE GOLD BAR on Harmsway's
He brought that up from the wreck.
...I see. Alarmed, Bond wants to stop Sidney from reaching into her
Sidney, I wouldn't - Too late. She drops the uranium tooth on his desk.
And what about this? Any idea what this is? Silence. Harmsway and Bond exchange a sober look. Then:
... I believe it's a depleted uranium drill bit, my dear. HE PRESSES AN ALARM UNDER HIS DESK. Bond reaches for the
Why don't we just take these -
(blocking him)
No. I want Sir Elliot to keep them. Harmsway stands, comes around the desk:
...Well! I do believe this requires further investigation!
Thank you, Uncle Elliot.
No matter what the British government says, I won't kill this story. (his secretary appears in the doorway)
Miss Oxford will show both of you to the elevator... And one of my people will definitely be in touch sooner than later.
I'm sure they will.
Good-bye, Mister Bond. He reaches to kiss Sidney - and looks in her eyes a secon
Good-bye, darling. Watching them exit, his smile turns hard and bitter.
As the Executive Secretary escorts them to the elevator, out the PICTURE WINDOW, with its view of the other tower.
Thank you both for coming in...
Five floors directly down is the GLASS-ENCLOSED SKY BRIDG above him, he sees TWO WINDOW WASHERS being pulled up on SCAFFOLD.
A CHIME SOUNDS; the elevator doors open. Bond and Sidney good-byes to the secretary and get in.
Sidney presses the button for "1". Bond glances at the FL CATOR with reads "55" - clocks the SECURITY CAMERA - and looking for an ESCAPE PANEL. Sidney watches out of the co eye, thinking he's nuts.
(glancing at the security camera)
... Do you have a gun?
What?
(yanking it down)
You heard me. A gun? (disabling it)
I left mine in the car.
That's funny: you struck me as the kind of man who always carries protection.
Listen to me! I'm a British secret service agent. And we have about two minutes before Harmsway kills both of us. He glances up at the escape panel at the rear of the car.
Has anyone ever suggested that you're a paranoid psychotic? Bond ignores the insult, explaining as he moves under the
Harmsway sank that ship and stole the gold. It's on the Sea Dolphin II. (boosting himself up)
And thanks to your little show and tell - (straining to open the panel)
- giving him the evidence - (popping it open)
We're the only ones who can tie him to the crime.
Elliot Harmsway is my Uncle!
Blood or Dutch?
He was my father's best friend!
He's killed closer.
You are seriously deranged.
Maybe. But why are we going up instead of down? He nods to the FLOOR INDICATOR. She looks: 60, 65, 70. IT Bond reaches down to her -
Sidney, come with me - THE DOORS OPEN. She looks at his outstretched hand with d
Not if my life depended on it.
Sidney comes out onto a floor still under construction. T doors CLOSE behind her. To the right, she sees STAMPER an Harmsway-blazered GUARD, with MACHINE PISTOLS.
Thank God! He's crazy!
Does he have a gun?
No. On Stamper's reply -
Good - He lunges for her, grabs her, spins her around, overwhelm She struggles, yelling:
This is a mistake!
(gun against her skull)

Shut up! Using Sidney as a HUMAN SHIELD, Stamper marches her in fr closed elevator doors. The guard follows. THEY POSITION T FOR A MASSACRE. Reaching around Sidney, Stamper pulls out STAMPER (into radio)
Open 14. A beat. It opens. The men unleash a HAIL OF BULLETS, then

The car is empty. Stamper perplexed. Pushing Sidney in fr him, he enters the elevator, cautiously... When, suddenly BOND SWINGS DOWN OUT OF THE ESCAPE PANEL (like an athlete bar) FEET FIRST - barely clearing Sidney's head as he KIC and the Guard in their faces. They go flying backwards. Bond jumps down, grabs Sidney -
Need a lift? And boosts her into the escape panel, following her up.
Bond and Sidney rush forward to the front wall as -
Recover, grab their guns, move to the threshold, and STAR CEILING WITH GUNFIRE.
Bond presses his body against Sidney, on the front wall, SHIELD HER as BULLETS RIP UP THE FLOOR behind them. With hand, Bond reaches up for the LATCH to open the door abov
Stamper stops shooting. Moves to the rear of the cab, und escape panel. Peers up. Sees nothing. Turns to the Guard:
Help me up.

Stamper's head pokes up through the hole just as Bond and disappeared into - INT. HALLWAY - (ELEVATOR BANK) - 71ST FLOOR. Squeezing out from between the elevator doors, (which imm close behind them,) Bond and Sidney encounter a group of OFFICE WORKERS, waiting for the elevator.
(to the office workers)
... I'd try the stairs. As Bond and Sidney scamper off -
(rushing out)
The stairs! (barking into his RADIO)
Attention all units! They're on the 71st floor!
Harmsway is striding towards the SECURITY CENTER, RADIO i
Stamper! They're not to leave this building alive!
Moving cautiously toward a CORNER of ANOTHER HALLWAY.
This has got to be a mistake.
The only mistake is that they didn't kill us in the elevator. At the corner, Bond STOPS, SEEING A GUARD, farther down t back to them) CHECKING DOORS.
Wait here.
No. I'm going with you. Bond frowns, but doesn't have the time to argue. They sta "DUCK AND COVER" in and out of doorways TO SNEAK UP ON HI
Harmsway bursts in on GUARDS watching a WALL OF SECURITY
Where are they?
I don't see them - (scanning the monitors)
There!
Bond and Sidney have just come into frame, sneaking up on
Warn him!
Porter! They're behind you -
(lifting the radio to reply)
Roger! Over and - BAM. BOND DECKS HIM.
Out. Bond kneels, grabs the GUARD'S MACHINE PISTOL, and CLIPS,

TWO GUARDS have entered from a STAIRCASE DOOR, hoisting M an instant: (1) Bond lets go a BURST. (2) The Guards SHOO diving for cover in the staircase door. (3) Bond rolls, ( Sidney into an open DOORWAY, and (5) returns A BURST, fro
Sidney is shaken. As Bond stands in the doorway, guarding
Okay. So it wasn't a mistake. (Bond lets go a blast)

What do we do now? Offer them dinner?!?! Bond glances back at the KITCHEN SUPPLIES. GETS AN IDEA. denly TWISTS, SMASHING the BUTT OF HIS GUN down on some G the counter, then TWISTS BACK, returning a BURST OF GUNFI
Come here. You shoot. I'll cook. She thinks he's nuts, but squeezes next to him. Handing h

Aim that way. Sidney scowls - as Bond moves off-camera - when suddenly, RIP UP THE DOOR FRAME. She jumps, TERRIFIED. Bond looks at her from the PHOTO-COPYING MACHINE, where h OUT the TONER CARTRIDGE. He offers a simple piece of advi
Shoot back! Sidney frowns... Turns... And as she LETS THE GUN RIP, we
Stamper, running up steps with the guard. They exit into:
They rush though it, bursting through a door into:
Stamper and the Guard start hunting Bond.
As she continues to exchange fire with the guards... BOND, (having broken the toner cartridge open,) is DUMPIN in a coffee can. He reaches for a BOX of sugar
One second - And (with GUNFIRE SFX over,) Bond sweeps the BROKEN DISH can, and drops his Q LIGHTER in the mix. He moves to Sidney, in the doorway. Kneels. In-between sh
... How did you get into marine salvage?
(gun burst, then)
My father left me the business. Bond glances at his watch, timing the bomb. The guards sh shoots back, then explains:
I used to be a divorce lawyer in New York City. Bond nods, continuing to look at his watch. Glances at he
Not a lot of difference.
What do you mean? Bond reaches forward to toss the coffee can -
Either way, you're taking the goods from dead hulks. He tosses the can, and PULLS HER BACKWARDS, covering her.
The GUARDS spring from the door, rushing forward to storm position - just as the COFFEE CAN rolls towards them, and

Stamper and the GUARD have arrived at the corner, BLASTIN

text: Damn! Swiftly, Bond grabs a JUG of CLEANER from under the sink, the door, and ROLLS IT DOWN THE HALL in Stamper's directi
Anticipate a bomb. They move back.
What the hell does that do?
Cleans dirt. Let's go.

Bond and Sidney BREAK for the STAIRCASE DOOR. (Where the were shooting at them from.) TWISTING AROUND, Bond lets a in Stamper's direction, as he stoops to scoop up one of t guards' MAC-l0's. INSERT - BOND'S BULLETS RIP UP THE JUG OF CLEANER.

head_text.subj: BOND AND SIDNEY ESCAPE FROM THE HALLWAY -

text: Cowers, waiting for the jug to blow up... Then realizes:
It's a trick! After him. (into his radio, on the run)
They're in the south stairwell!
Get more men up there!
Down? Bond leans over the railing. Sees GUARDS coming UP. SHOOT
Up. They go up about three stairs, and Sidney sees GUARDS des
Down?
(shoots, then)
Up. Bond and Sidney bound up the stairs through a METAL DOOR,
Stamper and the Guard bound down the hallway, heading for
Harmsway smiles, watching Bond on a monitor:
... And so much for that. (into radio)
They're on the 72nd floor set-back. (explains to the guards)
Nowhere to go.
It's magic hour as Bond and Sidney rush out onto the setb sees a WINDOW WASHER'S RIG. And although Sidney asks -
Now what? Bond's first concern is to make sure Stamper can't get th a pile of CONSTRUCTION EQUIPMENT, he spots a PNEUMATIC NA grabs it, and - BANG. BANG. BANG. He fires 3 NAILS through the door into

That should buy us some time. Now, Bond moves to the WINDOW WASHER'S RIG - a two-man bu scaffold ON TRACKS, with TWO LEATHER SAFETY HARNESSES ins LARGE CABLE SPOOL/MOTOR that stays on the roof. Approaching it, Bond looks over the side:
Twenty stories below is the sky bridge. 50 stories below ground. It's a long, long, way down.
Help me move this.
Darting up the few steps, Stamper and Guards arrive at th tries to open it. Won't budge.
I'll call for a battering ram -
No. Get the fire ax. One of the guards grabs it from inside a FIRE CABINET. He AX to Stamper, who takes the first SWING AT THE DOOR.
Bond is positioning the window washer rig. He explains:
We'll go down close to the sky bridge. We may be able to swing over and use it for cover. As Bond climbs into the bucket, Sidney peers over the sid
No way. I sail. I do not fly. BANG! Behind them, Stamper's AX HAS JUST PENETRATED THE D
... Sometimes, you just have to take the plunge. Bond yanks her in, flips switches on the control pod, and down, as fast as they can go.
Bond and Sidney descend. Tiny specs against the sunset.
Stamper gives the last few chops to the door. He kicks it
Stamper and the guards rush to the ledge.
Bond, looking up - for Stamper - and down - to check thei
All I know is one thing: If we get out of here alive, that gold is mine. (beat)
I've earned it. Looking upward, Bond SEES STAMPER peering over the rail.
One thing at a time.

Stamper jumps back from the ledge, enraged. Ax in hand, h the WINDOW WASHING RIG'S MACHINERY - And takes a roundhouse swing at the UNSPOOLING CABLE - bu cutting it, the ax BOUNCES OFF, and the RIG SLIDES ON ITS
Swings! Sidney SCREAMS - almost falling out. Bond grabs h are now 5 STORIES DIRECTLY ABOVE THE SKY BRIDGE, swaying pendulum - although still descending.
Having failed at the cable, Stamper goes at the PULLEY fe He swings. Swings again. With each blow, the pulley shaft
Dropping in VIOLENT SPURTS - just trying to stay in the d
Finally, the pulley shaft SHATTERS. THE CABLE GRINDS TO A
are stopped about 20 feet above the sky bridge.
(panicked, anxious, fast)
What now? And don't give me some movie cliche like 'trust me.'
(what the hell)
Trust me. And with this, he turns, and SHOOTS OUT the adjacent WIND
Let's go - But as he starts to climb out - SIDNEY SCREAMS! THE CABLE DROPS THEM 10 FEET LOWER, BELOW THE WINDOW.
Stamper whacks away at the side of the cable drum. It's c from its moorings.
look down at the curved glass top of the sky bridge - fac (she thinks) is certain death:
We're going to bounce off that thing! Bond looks up - assuming they have only seconds left befo cuts the cable. HE GRABS HER:
Hold on!
Stamper takes a final swing at the cable drum. With a GRE TERING SOUND it SNAPS FREE OF THE MOORINGS, smashes into and the whole mechanism CAREENS OVER THE SIDE OF THE BUIL
Bond and Sidney feel the cable give way. They start to fr BOND - FIRES HIS MACHINE PISTOL at the glass top of the s

text: Landing on the deck of the bridge. Bond rolls to his feet Fifty stories of cable from above is falling onto the dec yanks Sidney to the side of the building, just as THE CAB

text: Looking down, Stamper flips open his radio.
(over radio)
They're on the bridge. Seal off the 50th floor!
(looking at the monitors)
I should have hired this man. (to his guards)
Get somebody up there!
Bond is moving to the window washer rig debris.
What about the elevators? He steps to the side of the bridge, and looks at the rail inch pipe. Bond begins to work feverishly:
We tried that already. Remember? Bond picks up the cable and the leather harnesses.
You know, this is as much your fault as it is mine. Bond is slipping the cable around the railing pipe. One l
Sidney, we don't have time for this - He pulls on the loop to test it. Good enough. Makes a sec
Sure! Just when I want to talk - (beat)
Not that I would have believed you - Bond tests the second loop. He's satisfied. Turns to her:
Put your back to the railing. Sit up on it.
(doing it)
Are you listening to me?
Put your arms around my neck. Lock your legs around my waist.

... We have time for that? Just then, GUARDS APPEAR OUT OF FAR ELEVATOR DOOR. Runnin SHOOT. BOND FIRES A BURST BACK as - A NEW ROUND OF BULLET BEGINS TO RAIN DOWN ON THEM FROM ABOVE. BOND LOOKS UP: Stamper has commandeered a second window w rig, and is descending, FIRING AT THEM. Bond looks at Sidney -
Sometimes you just have to -
Don't say it. She locks her arms and legs around him, he snaps the leat around her waist, and they roll over the railing Amidst g
Bond and Sidney fall from the bridge - 50 stories up. They go down, And down, And down -
The cable looped around the railing is slowing their desc PAINT ON THE RAILING IS BURNING OFF, and the STEEL itself TO SMOKE from the friction.
Dropping - And Dropping. Looking to the ground, Bond sees the PRESS ROOM OBSERVATI coming up fast from below. It looks like they're going to splattered on the tile floor, when -
The cable comes to the end of its run! It DRAGS THE SPOOL BUCKET, and all the other MECHANICS to the side of the br SMASHING AGAINST THE WALL, JAMMING AGAINST THE RAILING.
Bond and Sidney jerk to a halt. They're swinging about fi from the balcony. There's a pause...
Is this - like - a normal day for you?
It's a lousy job, but - (reaching for the balcony)
The only reason I stay is for the health benefits. Bond PULLS THEM OVER TO THE BALCONY.
Stamper lands on bridge. He unbuckles his harness, runs t looks down and sees SIDNEY AND BOND climbing out onto the going for the PRESS ROOM DOOR.
(into his radio)
They're heading for the press room. Stop them!

Bond and Sidney enter at the top of the metal stairs Bond earlier to meet Harmsway. The Presses are running full blast; the noise is deafenin At the "start" end of the presses - where the paper is fe sees a GIANT ROLL OF NEWSPRINT on a CRANE, about to be lo Directly beyond this is the door to the elevator/wash-up Bond and Harmsway exited earlier. - Coming out of that DOOR, Bond sees THREE GUARDS in Harmsw carrying guns. BOND shoots the HOOK on the CRANE CARRYING THE NEWSPRINT It CRASHES TO THE GROUND, rolling backwards on the guards start scrambling around it - Bond and Sidney race down the stairs, turning in the oppo tion (toward the finishing end of the press, near the gar They encounter a GORILLA-SIZED PRESSMAN, with an oversize Bond and the Pressman square off. Bond tries to get aroun man lifts his crowbar to smash Bond with it. Bond tries t descending crowbar with his gun - but the crowbar snaps i Bond and the Pressman engage in a short, furious fight - each other against the side of the press... Which ends when Bond finally gets the upper hand for a se pushes the man back, into a pile of INK DRUMS. Momentaril Bond forces the man's head into an OPEN INK DRUM - And as he comes up, COVERED WITH INK, gasping for air, Si him on the head with the crowbar. Now, Bond and Sidney take off, toward the garage/exit - But one of the Guards (from the crashing roll of newsprin from between the banks of the printing press, tripping Bo Bond stumbles, face down - then spins over, kicking up at as he comes to finish Bond off. The Guard stumbles backward - Crashing against a NEWSPAPER BALING MACHINE. (A large mac wraps steel or plastic bands around bundles of papers for Rushing the man, Bond struggles with him - and manages to BALING SWITCH - literally tying the man up. The only prob as Bond turns - The LAST GUARD has Sidney in a choke-hold; he's aiming a Seemingly at once, (1) Sidney bites the Guard's forearm, ducks, (3) the Guard shoots wildly, (4) the gun drops, an Bond rushes the man, KNOCKING HIM BACKWARDS INTO THE PRIN pulling Sidney away at the last moment. The Guard is sucked up in the press rollers, and... The pages running through the newsprint web suddenly turn
He was bad news. Spotting more Guards coming down the far staircase, Bond and the gun, and runs to the NEWSPAPER DELIVERY CHUTE.

Down there! They jump into it, sliding down, and around an ALUMINUM C INT. GARAGE - HARMSWAY TOWERS. Bond and Sidney come out near a TROLLEY stacked with news Hearts pounding - having left the pressroom's deafening n they're ready for almost anything, except what they HEAR: The SOUND OF ONE MAN APPLAUDING. A polite, almost bored c
Vert, very, good Mr. Bond. Outstanding performance. Harmsway is standing with TEN GUARDS, shoulder to shoulde straight line, all HOLDING WEAPONS on Sidney and Bond. HARMSWAY (continuing)
I'm the certain the British taxpayers would be impressed by your efforts. Don't you agree?
I think they'd rather know who stole their gold. Harmsway can't help his ego:
(chuckles)
Why, I did, of course. It's on the Sea Dolphin II, twenty miles outside of Hong Kong... Not that it will do either of you any good to know. (beat)
Now both of you: Stand up. And toss the gun out, Mr. Bond. Bond SLIDES THE GUN several feet in front of him... And T TO HIS CAR, noting THE GUARDS ARE LINED UP DIRECTLY IN IT Bond begins to scheme.
Uncle Elliot: How could you do this to me? Bond sneaks his hand in his pocket.
Oh, please, Sidney. There's a hundred billion dollars at stake. (beat)
Besides, I never really liked your father that much. He cheated at cards. Bond has removed the CAR REMOTE CONTROL. He palms it.
Are your guards really going to kill a helpless girl?
My guards are from South Africa, Mr. Bond. This is their chance to get even with the formerly 'Great' Britain. (beat)
Now both of you. Put your hands on your heads, and step forward. Holding the remote control, Bond puts his hands on his he manipulating the control into the right position to use i
(trying to buy time)

What did you do, Harmsway? Make some deal with the Chinese government for the gold?.. Was the radioactive uranium I found in Venice part of it? He finally has the remote control in the right position.
Questions, questions, Mr. Bond... Which I'm afraid I've neither the time, nor the inclination to answer. (to the guards)

Take them out to the jungle and - Suddenly, BOND'S CAR ENGINE STARTS WITH A ROAR. The GUARD shock TOWARDS THE CAR, as: BOND retrieves the gun he slid out, and pulls Sidney behi newspaper trolley, while - THE CAR BEGINS TO MOVE, sending the guards scrambling. BOND takes his position with Sidney.
I forgot to mention: The job comes with a car. 007 begins shooting, as -

Kill it! Shoot the damn thing - THE GUARDS START BLASTING THE EMPTY MOVING CAR. They mana out the headlights, while - BOND is having trouble coordinating driving and shooting time. As bullets rip up the newspapers in front of them -
Here. You shoot. I'll drive.
...You know, that's another reason you're probably not in a successful relationship.
Another reason??? Did I miss something???
(taking the gun)
You insist on calling all the shots. (beat)
And by the way: I am not a helpless girl. Bond eyes her for one split second. Points at the guards:

Aim that way. Sidney starts to shoot as - THE GUARDS continue to blast away at the car... But: THE WINDOWS DON'T SHATTER. THE ARMOR-PLATED SIDE-PANELS ONLY DENT WITH BULLET HITS.. THE TIRES DON'T GO FLAT. There's chaos; a cacophony of voices and wild gunfire as THE CAR TO THEIR POSITION, where the door opens automatic
Ready? Now! The two of them make a break for the car, DIVING INSIDE.
- Bond guns the engine, slams the transmission into gear. rubber, GUARDS bounce off the front fenders.
Continue to shoot at the car.
Run for the HUM-VEES. Hop in and chase.
Bond flips open a hidden control panel. Flips a switch.
The TAIL-LIGHTS DROP DOWN and MACHINE GUNS start to fire.
Bond glances at the REARVIEW MIRROR. Sees the HUM-VEES. P another switch -
Whoosh! A MISSILE blasts out, trailing smoke as it hones THE FIRST HUM-VEE. BOOM! It's decimated.
Seal the garage! Cut the power! He's got no headlamps!
As the car screeches around a corner, the overhead lights
Bond flips down the visor: A THERMAL IMAGING DISPLAY drop
It looks just like the jet fighter videos from the Gulf W
Bond's car roars around a second turn, with sparks flying scrapes the walls. AHEAD, a MASSIVE ONE-PIECE DOOR is FOL FROM THE CEILING. A city street beyond.
We're not going to make it! Bond flips down a control panel from the RADIO. A DIGITAL begins to run through a set of numbers. Bond explains:
If it's radio controlled, it'll break the code.
If not?
(pointing to a button)
We blast through.

head_text.subj: THE CAR APPROACHES THE CLOSING DOOR AT HIGH SPEED -
BOND SEES THEY'RE NOT GOING TO MAKE IT. HE PUNCHES THE MI
TWO MISSILES ROAR OUT FROM THE FRONT OF THE CAR -
THEY EXPLODE AGAINST THE CLOSING DOOR

text: BOOM! CRASH! SILENCE. BLACK. After a moment, we HEAR THE FOOTSTEPS ON CEMENT.
The lights come on. The car is a twisted wreck, smashed a wall. Bond and Sidney are slumped forward, unconscious. Harmsway KNOCKS TWICE ON THE GARAGE DOOR, to demonstrate:
- Built to withstand a nuclear blast. (to Stamper, checking Bond's pulse)
Are they alive?
Yes. Shall we kill them?
No. I have a better idea. In fact, Mr. Bond may have actually improved my original plan. (beat)
Bring them both to Hong Kong. And Make sure he has nothing else up his sleeve.

It is early morning in this strange harbor - a place wher restaurant rise out of the fog; where an old Chinese man LA Laker's jersey practices tai-chi on the bow of an anci where sampans cut through the chop filled with ducks, com and women dressed in Chanel 1996, and Beijing 1256... Whi captains of these small water-taxis chatter away on cell- At the end of the harbor, dominating this scene, the CAME
